title: Software Developer för Cloud Telekom
description:
**Vill du vara med och utveckla mjukvara i teknikens absoluta framkant? På Combitech kan vi erbjuda tekniska utmaningar och ett meningsfullt arbete med målet att bygga ett mer motståndskraftigt och hållbart samhälle.**

**Din roll som Software Developer**
-----------------------------------


Vi söker nu mjukvaruutvecklare av komplexa system inom teknikområdet 5G Cloud. Du kommer att ingå i ett agilt team på cirka sju personer som ansvarar för produktens hela utvecklingscykel, d.v.s. systemering, design och test på flera nivåer. I uppdraget har ni som team nära samarbete med andra utvecklare, kravställare och testare. Exempel på språk och verktyg vi använder är C++, Python, Matlab, Kubernetes, Docker, Git*.* Du kommer att utgå från Combitechs kontor på Lindholmen där ca. 300 personer arbetar.

**Vem är du?**
--------------


Du har en civil- eller högskoleingenjörsexamen med relevant inriktning. Du skall ha ett stort intresse för teknik och har några års erfarenhet eller är relativt nyexaminerad. Du gillar att jobba i team där alla bidrar med sin kunskap för att nå gemensamma mål och att utveckla teamets arbetssätt och färdighet. Uppdraget förutsätter goda kunskaper i engelska såväl i tal som skrift, det är också meriterande om du behärskar svenska i tal och skrift.


För oss är dina personliga egenskaper viktiga och vi är väldigt lyhörda för dina intressen och karriärmål. Som konsult är du ambassadör för Combitech hos våra kunder, därför sätter vi stor vikt vid din personlighet.

**Då tjänsten innebär arbete som kan omfattas av försvarssekretess krävs det att du genomför och godkänns i en säkerhetsprövning.**

**Urval sker efter sommaren.** **Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!**

**Kom och gör skillnad**
------------------------


Till vårt affärsområde Autonomy and Connectivity i Göteborg arbetar ca 160 personer med spännande uppdrag i olika branscher så som rymd, satellit, telekom, försvar, radarsystem, gruvindustri och fordon. Våra konsulter arbetar huvudsakligen in-house hos Combitech i agila utvecklingsteam men det finns även möjligheter att arbeta på plats hos våra kunder.


Som konsult på Combitech kommer du även få ta del av våra interna utbildningar med bland annat kursveckor där du två gånger per år får chansen att utvecklas som konsult och person samt nätverka med medarbetare från hela Sverige.


Vi tror att man gör ett bättre jobb om man kan fokusera på rätt saker, därför gör vi det lätt att kombinera jobbet med vardagen. Vi satsar på våra medarbetare, de utgör kärnan, hjärnan och hjärtat i vår verksamhet. Dessutom står vi på en stadig grund av högteknologi, forskning och anställningstrygghet med försvars- och säkerhetskoncernen Saab som ägare.


För oss handlar det om hållbarhet - vi vill bli branschens mest hållbara företag; och för att vara ett hållbart företag i en hållbar framtid behöver vi investera i våra medarbetare. För oss är din återhämtning, dina utvecklingsmöjligheter och din trygghet lika viktigt som företagets framgång - utan våra medarbetare står vi stilla.

  

  

**Vill du veta mer om hur det är att arbeta hos oss? Kolla in** **våra karriärsidor!**


Kontaktperson/Rekryterande chef: Christer Lindstrand +46 102155879

title: Business Developer - Digital Services
description:
Every day, we get opportunities to make a positive impact – on our colleagues, partners, customers, and society. Together, we’re pioneering the solutions of the future and unlocking the full potential of precious resources. Trusted to act on initiative, we challenge conventional thinking to develop world-leading technologies that inspire progress in vital areas, including energy, food, water, and shipping.  

As we push forward, the innovative, open spirit that fuels our 140-year-old start-up culture and rapid growth also drives our personal growth. So, as we shape a more resourceful, less wasteful world, we build our careers too.  

About the job
Customers are accelerating smart manufacturing and predictive maintenance initiatives. New players such as IoT platform providers and companies using big data to improve customer processes are growing stronger in the market. This brings a need to accelerate development and deployment of new business models and partnerships for Alfa Laval. Over the last year we have developed and started offering a connectivity solution, the Smart Heat Exchanger, to the Market and we are now looking for a Business Developer who can continue this journey as well as contribute to the identification and development of additional Digital Services for our portfolio.
The overarching task is to accelerate the market activities for the Smart Heat Exchanger solution. This includes leading and coordinating cross-functional activities with a focus on the market, that are required for this offering to succeed. The role will also play an important role in developing and deploying other new digital service solutions emerging from the learnings and upcoming trends and market demands in this field. The role will be based in Lund and will include 50-80 days of international travels per year. Responsibilities will include:* Own the Smart Heat Exchanger solution from a commercial product perspective
* Develop and maintain the connectivity program roadmap with a focus of the rollout into relevant markets including strategic & organizational fit, training as well as change management
* Identifying and driving collaboration with partners in key customer segments
* Being the main interface and driving demands towards internal stakeholders
* Identify, develop and implement new Digital Service Business Models and its alignment with the GPHE Service Product Portfolio
  

Who you are
The modus operandi in the area of digital and connected services will continue to be agile as the market and related technologies are evolving in a fast pace. To thrive in this position, we believe that you have a strong business mindset, strategic thinking combined with a hands-on attitude. You are a positive and flexible team player that can easily grasp complexity and out of this create clarity and progress. You have strong networking and coordination skills and driving change sustainably is something that you are passionate about.  

What you need* Have an academic degree as a base and at least five years’ experience in roles with exposure to direct customers in the industries we serve.
* Have a strong interest in IoT, Smart Manufacturing, Digitalization and the opportunities it brings.
* Ideally you have driven the development of a business before and are passionate about business development.
* You also have a proven record in delivering results in a global matrix organization.
* Previous experience in heat transfer technology is beneficial.
  

What’s in it for you
We offer a challenging position in an open and friendly environment where we help each other to develop and create value. Your will work in a global environment with the future of Service and your work will have a true impact on Alfa Laval’s future success.  

For further information please contact:
Solveigh Plenge, Manager Global Service Management – Digital & Channel, BU GPHE +491718684148
Pasindhu Mendis, Talent Acquisition, pasindhu.mendis@alfalaval.com  

For Union Information, please contact:
Johan Ranhög, Akademikerföreningen, +46 730 576 410
Bror Garcia Lantz, Unionen, +46 709 366 985
Stefan Sandell, Ledarna, +46 709 787 364  

We review applications continually so please send in your application as soon as possible. Applications sent directly via email will be disregarded without notice due to GDPR.  

We care about diversity, inclusion, and equity in our recruitment processes. We also believe behavioural traits can provide important insights into a candidate's fit to a role. To help us achieve this we apply Pymetrics assessments, and upon application you will be invited to play the assessment games.
#LI-PM1

title: Fullstackutvecklare .NET
description:
Vill du ta chansen att komma till ett utvecklarteam som arbetar verksamhetsnära inom försäkringsområdet? Vi i team DOOL söker efter en fullstackutvecklare .NET som kan vara med på vår transformationsresa, skapa långsiktigt värde för våra kunder och samtidigt må bra på vägen.


**Fullstackutvecklare .NET | Skandia | Stockholm & Sundsvall**



Som Fullstackutvecklare .NET på Skandia arbetar du med att utveckla och förvalta applikationer inom försäkringshandläggning och rådgivning i Spartåget. Du blir en del av team DOOL som har ansvar för utveckling och förvaltning av flera applikationer som används av över 500 handläggare och rådgivare på Skandia idag.


**Om teamet**



Teamet sitter idag både i Stockholm och Sundsvall. Vi har en flexibel arbetsmiljö och en kultur präglad av samarbete och högt i tak. Vi strävar efter att skapa en inkluderande arbetsplats där alla kan bidra och utvecklas.


*Just nu letar vi flera .Netutvecklare till olika team. Du hittar övriga annonser på vår karriärsida och på LinkedIn.*



**Hos oss får du möjlighet att**


* Arbeta med nyutveckling i .NET 8 och React JS 18.
* Förvaltningsansvar över flertalet applikationer som är byggda i både .NET, .NET Framework, ASP och VB.Net med MSSQL som databas.
* Sitta med anrop mot Skandias API:er genom ett gemensamt tjänstelager och byggen via Azure DevOps samt Octopus Deploy.
* Vara en del av ett team som ansvarar för att kravställa, designa och implementera lösningar.
* Bidra till långsiktig värdeskapande och skapa trygghet för våra kunder.
* Arbeta i en hybrid miljö med flexibilitet att växla mellan kontoret och hemmet.

**För att trivas och lyckas i rollen ser vi att du:**


* Är proaktiv och har förmåga att se helheten och jobba över stora kontaktytor.
* Är driven, ansvarstagande och engagerad i sitt arbete.
* Har god förmåga att kommunicera kring problem och lösningar på både affärs- och teknisk nivå.

  
**Kvalifikationer**
-------------------


* Har några års erfarenhet som systemutvecklare.
* Erfarenhet av C#, .NET och .NET Framework.
* Kunskap i React Javascript.
* Arbetat med SQL Server.
* Kan uttrycka sig väl i svenska både i tal och skrift.


**Meriterande**


* Erfarenhet av att använda Azure DevOps och Octopus Deploy.
* Erfarenhet av ASP och VB.Net.


Vi jobbar med löpande urval så tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan redan idag. I ansökan kommer vi att ställa ett antal urvalsfrågor som ligger till grund för urvalet. För att göra rekryteringsprocessen så rättvis och objektiv som möjligt kommer det att ingå intervjuer, tester, bakgrundskontroll samt digital referenstagning.



Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!


***Urval för denna rekrytering kommer att påbörjas i augusti.***


Vårdförsäkringar och hälsoförsäkring


Vår företagskultur styrs av engagemang


Balans i livet och ett bra friskvårdserbjudande


Förmånlig tjänstepension


Bidrar till att göra skillnad


Förmånlig ränta på bolån


Extra semesterdagar


3 flexibla lediga dagar varje år

title: .NET Utvecklare
description:
**.NET Utvecklare | Skandia | Stockholm**



Till ett av våra .NET team som har en central roll inom dokument-ärendehantering på Skandia söker vi nu en backendutvecklare. Som .NET utvecklare i teamet kommer du att arbeta mycket med par- och mobbprogrammering samt självständigt arbete. Gillar du hur system, flöden och processer fungerar är uppbyggda? Ta då chansen och sök rollen!



**Om teamet**



Teamet består av 11 personer och innefattar roller som Product Owner, Scrum Master, IT-testare, .NET-utvecklare, IT-utvecklare samt systemansvarig. Vi arbetar enligt SAFe-metodiken och värdesätter en arbetsmiljö med högt i tak och god sammanhållning. Teamet sitter idag i Stockholm och arbetar hybrid.



*Just nu letar vi flera .Netutvecklare till olika team. Du hittar övriga annonser på vår karriärsida och på LinkedIn.*



**Hos oss får du möjligheten att**


* Jobba med Skandias dokumenthantering av våra e-arkiv.
* Utveckla och förvalta våra ärendehanteringssystem med fokus på backendutveckling i Microsoft .NET Framework och .NET Core.
* Arbeta med Microsoft SQL Server som databas.
* Implementera och arbeta enligt driftprinciperna kontinuerlig integration (CI) och kontinuerlig leverans (CD) med hjälp av Azure DevOps Server och Octopus Deploy.
* Utforska och tillämpa ny teknik, nya miljöer och nya sammanhang som en naturlig del av arbetet.
* Bidra till kontinuerlig förbättring inom både teknik och arbetssätt.
* Arbeta självständigt och ta egna initiativ samtidigt som du stärker gruppsammanhållningen.


**För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att**



Du är en prestigelös person som kan samarbeta med andra och dela kunskap inom teamet. Du har en passion för problemlösning och är analytisk med en god förmåga att se helheten och förstå slutkonsumenternas behov. Du har ett driv att kontinuerligt förbättras och värdesätter arbete i ett agilt team. Du är självgående, initiativrik, och arbetar för att stärka gruppsammanhållningen.


  
**Kvalifikationer**
-------------------


* Några års arbetserfarenhet inom systemutveckling.
* Erfarenhet av Microsoft .NET Core och Microsoft .NET Framework (med fokus på backend).
* Kunskap inom Microsoft SQL Server.
* Kan flytande svenska både i tal och skrift.

**Meriterande**



* Erfarenhet av system som använder meddelandebuss.
* Kunskap om NServiceBus.
* Erfarenhet av frontendutveckling med React och TypeScript.


Vi jobbar med löpande urval så tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan redan idag. I ansökan kommer vi att ställa ett antal urvalsfrågor som ligger till grund för urvalet. För att göra rekryteringsprocessen så rättvis och objektiv som möjligt kommer det att ingå intervjuer, tester, bakgrundskontroll samt digital referenstagning.



***Nu är vi på semester! Urvalet kommer att inledas i augusti.***

Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!


Vårdförsäkringar och hälsoförsäkring


Vår företagskultur styrs av engagemang


Balans i livet och ett bra friskvårdserbjudande


Förmånlig tjänstepension


Bidrar till att göra skillnad


Förmånlig ränta på bolån


Extra semesterdagar


3 flexibla lediga dagar varje år

title: Developer till VIMLA
description:
Om Vimla!
Vimla är inte någon klassisk telekomoperatör. Vi är den coola kusinen i Telenor-familjen som erbjuder mobiltelefoni med en twist! Vi tar kundfokus, enkelhet och schyssthet till en ny nivå på den svenska mobilmarknaden och i vårt team. Vi tänker på kunden först och vill att det ska vara enkelt och roligt att vara kund hos oss.  

  

Vi är Vimla – mobiloperatören med bra vibrationer! Nu har du chansen att joina teamet i rollen som Senior utvecklare, ta chansen och sök nu.  

Vad du kommer att göra
I rollen som Senior utvecklare på Vimla kommer du in i en spännande scale-up miljö där du tillsammans med ditt team arbetar i syfte att underhålla och utveckla Vimlas tekniska miljö. Du tillhör och arbetar tillsammans med ett tight DevOps team som består av såväl juniora som mer seniora kollegor vilket medför en härlig kultur av kontinuerligt lärande och kunskapsdelning. Varje dag bjuder på en ny utmaning som ger dig möjligheten att bidra till något större.
Du kommer att kunna arbeta med några av de bästa verktygen och teknikerna, och skapa och utveckla API:erna mikrotjänsterna som kommer att ligga i centrum för vår digitala kundresa och stödja utvecklingsaktiviteter mellan olika teknologier.
Hos oss för du möjlighet att utmanas, utveckla din kompetens och få möjlighet att arbeta med verkligt fantastiska och kompetenta kollegor. Om du gillar att ha en möjlighet att påverka vad du jobbar med, en bredd av arbetsuppgifter och jobba i ett tight DevOps-team - det här är platsen för dig!
Vi söker dig som
På Vimla så värdesätter vi individer som är angelägna om att lära sig och utveckla sin egen kompetens. Vi ser att du har tidigare erfarenhet av utveckling av backend tjänster i något av följande system: Java, Kotlin, Quarkus spring eller annan Java EE framwork. Du har fokus på leverans säkerställer alltid god kvalitet i slutresultatet. Vi tror också att du tidigare har erfarenhet från att designa, bygga och underhålla distruberade system i en molnbaserad miljö (tex AWS).  

Du har:* Erfarenhet av arbete i ett agilt utvecklingsteam med vanliga verktyg som Jira och Git.
* Praktisk erfarenhet av att arbeta med DevOps och CI/CD (Docker, Docker swarm, github actions), PostgreSQL, TDD och erfarenhet av att bygga integrationsprojekt i API:s. Har du inte erfarenheter av docker swarm men har erfarenhet av Kubernetes är det ett plus.
* Erfarenhet från telekommunikationssektorn.
* Bekväm med att arbete i en Linux-miljö
* Typescript, shell och nushell är meriterande språk men inget krav.


Vi förväntar oss inte att du känner till alla teknologier i vår stack, så vi letar efter någon med ett tillväxttänk och en vilja att lära sig!  

Vårt löfte
En balanserad personalstyrka är nyckeln till vår framgång. För att säkra det är vi fast beslutna att främja en arbetsmiljö där våra anställda får stöd och befogenheter inom alla områden av sitt arbete. Vi lovar dig ett företag som vill lära sig och snabbt anpassa sig till en digital värld där du välkomnas in i ett skickligt team av professionella och kunniga kollegor.
Dessutom får du:* Ett flexibelt sätt att arbeta – Vi tror att flexibilitet och frihet att välja var och hur du ska utföra ditt arbete är en drivkraft för prestation, engagemang och balans i arbetslivet. Vi tror också på kraften i bättre tillsammans och att lagandan utvecklas när vi träffas och interagerar personligen, därför fungerar våra kontor som magneter för samarbete, kreativitet och företagsanda
* Ett generöst hälso- och förmånspaket med till exempel friskvårdsbidrag, sjukförsäkring, ”ge mig en paus”-dagar, tjänstepension och mycket mer.
* Utvecklingsprogram för att fördjupa dina kunskaper och bredda kompetensen


Varför du vill jobba på Vimla
Vimla är på en spännande tillväxtresa och möjligheterna att växa och utvecklas tillsammans med oss är enorma. Vi är ett roligt, tight team på runt 50 personer. Vimla är en del av Telenor Sverige.  

Ansök idag!
Om du är intresserad och vill veta mer, kontakta Robin Lidberg, Head of Product Development & Tech: robin@vimla.se
Vi utvärderar inte CV:n som skickas direkt till oss på e-post. *V**i* *kommer utvärdera ansökningar i augusti.*
Bra att veta
I enlighet med Telenors policy genomför vi en bakgrundskontroll på slutkandidater i alla rekryteringar.  

Plats: Stockholm Råsunda
Flexibelt arbete: Ja, med 3 dagar/vecka på kontor

title: Front End Developer
description:
Job Description: Front End Developer

Location: Abu Dhabi

**The Opportunity:**

Looking for a seasoned and creative Frontend Engineer to design & build front end applications by implementing visual elements in web applications and translating UI/UX design wireframes into programming language to deliver innovative frontend engineering solutions that are stable, high-performing, secure, accessible, and measurably profitable for Presight’s customer

**Key Responsibilities:** 

You will provide expertise in the advanced knowledge of applications programming, ensure that application design adheres to the overall architecture blueprint, and design fully responsive applications by writing clean, tested, modular, and well-documented code.

Functional

* Develop optimal solutions to enhance user experience, optimizing maximum speed, scalability and technical feasibility.
* Document software deliverables through use cases, design documents and technical specifications by helping with story creation, user acceptance criteria, QA and overall end-to end testing.
* Understand libraries, patterns and platforms required to implement web applications in a lucid, structured, and scalable manner.
* Utilize advanced knowledge of system flow and develop standards for coding, testing, debugging and implementation.
* Partner with multiple teams to ensure appropriate integration of functions as well as identify and define necessary system enhancements to deploy new products and process improvements.
* Participate in design and architecture reviews and offer inputs for improvements.
* Understand complex business requirements and provide innovative & apt technical solutions.
* Provide in-depth analysis with interpretive thinking to define issues and develop creative, profitable solutions.
* Comply with QHSE (Quality Health Safety and Environment), Business Continuity, Information Security, Privacy, Risk, Compliance Management and Governance of Organizations policies, procedures, plans and related risk assessments.

**Requirements:** 

* Bachelor’s degree in data science, Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering or related field
* Minimum 6 years of experience in front end web development
* At least 3 years of experience in building robust web applications in AI service organization or analytics industry
* Strong computer science and basic algorithms knowledge.
* 3+ years of experience coding in Vanilla Javascript.
* Knowledge of web fundamentals: HTML5/CSS3, protocols, modern web standards.
* Expert knowledge of modern JavaScript and TypeScript.
* Experience building single page applications with React, or any other component based framework.
* Strong understanding of state management in front end apps, production experience working with MobX or Redux.
* Experience in media operations in browser (Canvas, Audio and Video APIs).
* Understanding of relational and non-relational databases (MySQL, MongoDB, etc).
* Strong knowledge about programming principles (SOLID).
* Knowledge of RESTful APIs design.
* Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: Up to 25 000,00kr per month

Application Question(s):

* Whar is your notice period? (In days)
* Are you willing to move to Abu Dhabi or already based in Abu Dhabi?

Experience:

* JavaScript: 4 years (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: HIL Framework Developer
description:
Work with testing in dSpace HIL environment för battery managment system software.
  
Primary work assignments to write test cases and perform tests in HIL rig. Including preparation of HIL models for testing and automation. Also some work with integration of test objects to HIL.
  
Knowledge of dSpace toolchains highly meriting as is good matlab/simulink knowledge.

title: Cloud Application Platform Developer
description:
Are you a skilled software engineer ready to elevate your career? If you're enthusiastic about developing and maintaining robust, scalable platforms for cutting-edge applications, we invite you to join Zenseact as a Senior Developer in Platform Engineering!

#### **Insights from the team**


Zenseact, a dynamic force in automotive software development, houses Team Mimer, specialists in platform management with a focus on Azure cloud, Kubernetes, and clean code practices. We're on the lookout for a Senior Developer to contribute to our mission of delivering cutting-edge solutions in the automotive industry.


The purpose of Team Mimer is to develop our cloud platform and support application teams in efficient application development. We create and maintain testing and production environments, continuous integration and delivery systems, tools and services that enable other teams work with our data and infrastructure. Our team fosters an open, friendly, self-governing, and friendly culture. To thrive with us, you should be empathetic, accountable, and self-motivated, with interest in taking initiative. Collaboration, transparency, and good communication are essential. You'll support and guide team members, listen to their challenges, and assist in finding solutions.

#### **Your mission and day-to-day tasks**


As a Senior Developer in Platform Engineering at Zenseact, you will play a pivotal role in leading collaborative efforts with cross-functional teams and applying your deep expertise in Python and Java. Your mission involves understanding team requirements, crafting innovative platform solutions, and integrating diverse technologies to enhance our infrastructure and platform.


In this role, you will be instrumental in developing and maintaining our critical infrastructure and leveraging Azure Cloud technologies to create and manage scalable environments. You will also lead CI/CD initiatives to streamline our software release process and apply your advanced troubleshooting skills to ensure platform reliability and resilience.

**Key Responsibilities**:

* Lead cross-functional teams utilizing your expertise in Python and Java.
* Develop and maintain critical infrastructure, including Kubernetes and Kafka.
* Leverage Azure Cloud technologies for scalable environment creation and management.
* Create and manage CI/CD pipelines to streamline software releases and enhance team efficiency.
* Proactively troubleshoot and resolve platform issues to minimize downtime and ensure reliability.

### **What’s in it for you**

* Influence product direction in a dynamic industry with a life-saving mission.
* Shape your role based on your competencies and interests.
* Work at the forefront of tech in one of Sweden’s biggest and most interesting, challenging and dynamic AI/ML-companies.
* Collaborate with highly skilled, innovative, creative and smart people.
* Work with people from all over the world, close to what science just came up with.
* Enjoy a flexible work approach and a genuinely good work/life balance.

#### **Qualifications & experience**

**Essential experience**

* Bachelor’s or Master’s in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
* 5+ years of professional experience in software development using Python and/or Java.
* Experience with cloud platforms (Azure preferred).
* CI/CD pipeline experience (preferably Azure DevOps).
* Version control experience (preferably Git).
* Familiarity with Kubernetes or other container orchestration
* Moderate Linux experience.

**Nice to have**

* Experience with other clouds (e.g., GCP or AWS).
* Familiarity with other CI/CD systems (e.g., Jenkins, GitHub Actions).
* Knowledge of other programming languages (e.g., C++, Golang).
* Cybersecurity experience.


If you’re ready to shape the future of our platform and work with a team of skilled employees, apply today to join us as a Senior Developer in Platform Engineering!

#### **More about Zenseact**

 **Our software makes a difference.**  

Using AI-based technology to create the ultimate driver support, we’re fighting to end car accidents and make roads safe for everyone. Every year, around 1,4 million people die in traffic while approximately 50 million people get injured. Many get disabled as a result of their injury. We can do better.

**One purpose, one product.**  

We’re a software company dedicated to revolutionizing car safety. By designing the complete software stack for autonomous driving and advanced driver-assistance systems, we’re fighting to end car accidents and make roads safe for everyone. Zenseact was founded by Volvo Cars, and the teams are based in Gothenburg, Sweden, and Shanghai, China. When we aim for zero accidents faster, we strive to speed up the transition to safe automation. This is essentially achieved by making cars updatable – like a computer or a phone. With regular software updates, a vehicle can be made safer long after its production. By accelerating improvement loops, shortening development cycles, and deploying high-capacity software quickly, we can make cars safer, and faster.

**Culture with people at heart**  

To achieve our mission of saving lives and ending traffic accidents we must go where nobody has before. It requires us to venture into the unknown, pioneering new technology and pushing the frontier of autonomous driving. While there’s no denying our determination and expertise, we must stand united to succeed. By fostering a culture of support and enablement – a place of psychological safety where all of us can thrive – everything else will follow. We call this a **people-at-heart culture.** This culture means caring. It means the company cares about me, and we care about one another. It means sharing, so we give each other energy and have fun together. Our culture is also about belonging. It’s important to feel at home and that we can be ourselves at work. Finally, a people-at-heart culture means well-being. So, we enjoy the flexibility needed to be and do our best – at work and in life.

*Zenseact works proactively to create a culture of diversity and inclusion, where individual differences are appreciated and respected. To drive innovation we see diversity as an asset, which means we value and respect differences in gender, race, ethnicity, religion or other belief, disability, sexual orientation or age, etc.*  

  

*Interviews are held continuously, so we highly recommend that you submit your application at your earliest convenience.*

title: Backend Software Engineer (.NET Core)
description:
**About Us**
 Sinch is a global leader in cloud communications, helping businesses connect with their customers on their mobile phones. We reach every phone on earth, with over 147 billion conversations every year. Our technology powers the world's leading communications platforms.
   

  

 We are a dynamic and innovative team seeking a passionate Backend Software Engineer (.NET Core) to collaborate on our cloud-based communication solutions that are built using the latest versions of C# and .NET Core hosted on AWS using cloud native technologies like Kubernetes and Docker.
   

  

 The working model is hybrid, and you can work from Stockholm or Malmo office.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Create systems that are not only scalable but also resilient, ensuring graceful failure.
* Manage the software lifecycle from design and development to testing and production deployment.
* Work with a range of different technologies and programming languages, but primarily with C# and .NET Core.
* Actively contribute to enhancing our development processes and pipelines.
* Take a hands-on approach to monitoring production environments, identifying issues, and being on-call when necessary.
* Engage closely with software engineers, architects, DevOps specialists, and product managers to deliver exceptional products.


**Requirements**
* Experienced professional in team-based development, deployment, and maintenance of software products in production.
* In-depth knowledge of .NET Core and a deep passion for technology.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills in English.
* Ability to work effectively within a cross-functional self-organizing team, fostering collaboration and mutual respect among team members.
* A passion for writing clean and testable code.
* Bachelor's degree in computer science or related technical discipline.


**Good to have**
* Experience in a similar industry or related one.
* Experience working with service-oriented architecture and distributed systems.
* Experience with Kubernetes or similar technologies.
* Experience working with AWS.
* Proven ability to work with others to solve tough technical problems.
* Ability to thrive in a dynamic and fast-paced work environment characteristic of agile development methodologies.
* Experience guiding and mentoring fellow developers empowering them to contribute effectively to team goals.


**Embrace the challenge and join us!**

title: Junior Product Developer to H&M Kids Baby
description:
**Job Description**
**Job Description**
**Working at H&M Kids Baby**
 We are looking for You who have a passion for the baby Customer and are excited about taking part in building a Global assortment for the future generation!
   

  

 With a Sustainable & durable approach we create our assortment for every baby, every season, everywhere!
   

  

 We welcome all mindsets and cultures with the belief that different perspectives will make us successful. Within our team we believe in progress by having a growth mindset and together we challenge our boundaries.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
 As a junior product developer on Baby, you will be the one in your team focusing on developing exciting products. You will together with your team drive the developments for the best product and constantly overview, evaluate, follow up and make suggestions of improvements. Your main focus will be the baby and toddler customer. You will be working with a wide range of products and materials where knowledge of complex timelines and structure is crucial.
   

  

 You will work in close collaboration with the senior product developers, product manager, planners, designers and pattern makers.
   

  

 As a Junior Product Developer at baby, you should be comfortable with working independently and taking own initiatives and like to work with the rest of the team to develop the best product and best assortment in line with the visual goals.
   

  

**Qualifications**
**Qualifications**
* Experience from working with product development or as a Buyer
* Passion for the Baby customer and staying up to date with the latest trends
* Have a good sense of fashion and passion for products
* Result-oriented and a business growth mindset
* Structured and organized.
* Are a strong team player with great communication skills
* Have a strong salesmanship and commercial thinking
* Have the courage to make decisions.
* Always see possibilities, improvements, and simple solutions


**Additional Information**
 Additional information
   

  

**This is a temporary position with an 11-month contract, starting as soon as possible** 
 with placement in Stockholm. If you feel your experience, skills and ambitions are right for this role, please send your application
 **including CV at the latest 4th August.** 
 Interviews will be held continuously. (For internal candidates, please remember to initiate a dialogue with your current manager before applying.)
   

  

**Benefits**
 We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP.
   

  

 In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.
   

  

**Inclusion & Diversity**
 H&M is a part of H&M Group. At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.
   

  

 We strive to have a fair and equal process and therefore kindly ask you
 **not to attach a cover letter** 
 in your application as they often contain information that easily can trigger unintentional biases.
   

  

**Company Description**
 The H&M Head Office is based in Stockholm, Sweden, where we design and develop our fashion collections for a wide variety of customers. H&M is a dynamic international workplace where high pace and rapid changes are a natural part of our day. Good communication skills, a flexible attitude and capacity to adapt to changes are essential. We have a sustainable mindset and always seek new ways to improve our sustainable working methods to achieve our goals.
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Platform Engineer
description:
**Company Description**
 H&M is on a journey to meet and exceed our customers' expectations today and tomorrow. Through collaboration, innovation, and technology, we challenge ourselves and the industry. To cater to the individual needs and desires of our millions of customers, our tech organization delivers solutions for the entire value chain for all our brands. We are accelerating digitalization, and to stay relevant, we need to ensure we have strong leaders in place to bring our best capabilities, innovation ideas, and talented technologists to support the transformation of H&M.
   

  

 Would you like to work in an internationally agile-driven environment on solutions used in various parts of the world? Do you consider yourself a proactive, self-driven colleague who can take full ownership of the initiative working both independently and as part of a group?
   

  

**Job Description**
 At H&M, our AI, Analytics, and Data department is at the cutting edge of data-driven decision-making. We leverage advanced analytics, AI, and machine learning to tackle complex challenges and drive business growth. Our team is dynamic, innovative, and dedicated to pushing the boundaries of what’s possible with data. We are seeking a skilled Backend Developer to join our talented team and contribute to our mission of enabling the full enterprise to harness the power of data.
   

  

**Responsibilities:**
* Design, build, and maintain data pipelines on Google Cloud Platform (GCP) using services such as BigQuery, Dataplex, Dataflow/Dataproc, Pub/Sub, Cloud Functions, Cloud Run, Cloud Scheduler and Cloud Workflows.
* Develop and implement data models using dbt (data build tool) to support analytical reporting and data science needs.
* Collaborate with data analysts and business stakeholders to understand data requirements and translate them into data models.
* Implement data quality checks and monitoring to ensure high quality of data in our data warehouse.
* Optimize data pipelines and data models for performance and cost efficiency.
* Document and communicate data models to the wider team and train them on how to use it effectively.
* Good knowledge of Terraform
* Experience in building CI/CD pipelines using GitHub Actions.


**Qualifications**
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field, or equivalent experience.
* Proven experience as a Data Engineer or in a similar role.
* Strong experience with Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and its data services such as BigQuery, Cloud Run, and Pub/Sub.
* Experience in data modelling and transformation using dbt.
* Knowledge of SQL and good experience with Python.
* Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Excellent communication skills and the ability to explain complex topics in simple terms.


 Why Join Us?
   

  

* Innovative Environment: Work on cutting-edge technologies and innovative projects.
* Professional Growth: Opportunities for continuous learning and professional development.
* Collaborative Culture: Be part of a supportive team that values collaboration and excellence.
* Competitive Benefits: We offer a competitive salary, comprehensive benefits, and flexible working arrangements.


 If you are passionate about backend development and eager to work on exciting projects that make a real impact, we would love to hear from you. Apply now to join our team and help us shape the future of data-driven innovation!
   

  

**Additional Information**
 This is a fulltime position with placement in Stockholm. If your experience, skills, and ambitions are right for this role, please apply with CV in English.
   

  

**Please do not send applications to individual email address, due to GDPR, we only accept applications through our career page. We look forward to receiving your application!**
*H&M is committed to creating a diverse & inclusive environment and we are actively looking for qualified candidates irrespective of race, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, national origin, disability, or age.*

title: Senior Dotnet Developer
description:
Are you excited about finding ways to make code more efficient and less costly?
 



  





 Join us at Instabridge. Our vision is a
 *free global internet* 
 .
 



  





 We have apps that make it possible for people to get online, no matter their current income.
 



  





 What’s our traction like?
 


* We have 10 million monthly active users.
* We are profitable.



  





 Who are our users?
 



 Our users are all over the world. The common factor is that they want to save money on their internet connection.
 



  





 Some use Instabridge when they are traveling, to avoid finding a new telco provider in their destination. Others use Instabridge because they only have limited data on their phone today.
 



  





 Where are we heading?
 



 We have a lot of traction on our apps, and are looking for someone that wants to be part of our journey.
 



  





 Your role would be focused on back-end development in dotnet. More specifically, we are looking for someone who can initiate lots of projects that make our existing code more efficient and cheaper to run on our cloud providers.
 



  





 This mean you will find improvement projects for in our current architecture and infrastructure. You will also initiate development projects that realizes the improvement opportunities.
 



  





 Skills and Requirements
 



 To succeed in the role you need to:
 


* Have experience with dotnet development on AWS and/or GCP
* Further experience with AWS API Gateway, AWS Elastic Beanstalk, AWS Lambda, PostgreSQL
* Have an interest to work on making infra more efficient and cheaper



  





 Some other things we would love for you to have experience with:
 


* AWS EC2
* AWS CloudWatch
* AWS RDS
* Heroku
* Cloudflare
* AWS ElastiCache
* AWS VPC
* Performance and system monitoring-tools like NewRelic, Datalog etc.



  





 Why Instabridge?
 



 At Instabridge, you will give free internet to the world. Something that democratize internet for real. You will also be part of one of the fastest-growing startups in Sweden right now.
 



  





 Apply today
 



 We are actively recruiting for this role. We will reach out to you at the latest 2 days after your application.
 



  





 Please apply today by clicking "Easy Apply".

title: DEVELOPER
description:
**Developer**
 Digital Customer Solutions at SAS Digital & IT is looking for a Full stack developer
   

  

 Our teams build digital services to help customers to find, buy and change SAS services and products and enable smooth travel. To continue our transformation journey we are looking for full-stack developers to bring further energy, competence and skills to our teams
   

  

**In This Role Your Main Responsibilities Will Be To**
* Understand needs from business and translate then into working software
* Secure application compliance with regulation (GDPR, Accessibility) and SAS IT security
* Understand when and how to make performance optimizations and trade-offs
* Design architecture and solutions based on MVP model that can scale to enterprise solutions
* Work in close collaboration with Digital Project Owner to secure delivery according to the business backlog
* Define processes with QA lead to secure high-quality and high-performing digital product
* Coach, code review and pair programming with junior developers
* Proactively suggest digital solutions that can help the organization meet its goals


**Main Tech Skills And Competence**
* Experience with JavaScript libraries and frameworks
* Proficiency with Node.js and Typescript
* Hands-on experience in React.js web applications
* Experience using build tools (Docker)
* Experience designing and integrating RESTful and GraphQL APIs
* Experiences in Java 11+ and Spring Boot Technologies within microservice architectures
* Familiarity with database technology such as MySQL, Postgres, Cosmos DB and MongoDB
* Familiarity with cross-platform front-end mobile app framework (i.e. Flutter)
* Familiarity with micro frontend architectures


**Experiences With Tools But Not Limited To**
* Git
* Azure Cloud Platform
* Github
* Kubernetes
* Terraform


**We Believe You Are**
* Eager to put your creativity and sense of innovation to work in order to further develop SAS
* A team player who enjoys being a part of a high performing multi skilled customer centric team producing high quality enterprise solutions based on RESTful APIs and modern front-end web and mobile app applications


**Why work at SAS?**
 We engage a Digital First mindset, encouraging a fail fast, learn fast environment with cross functional and agile teams focusing on fast delivery, quick iterations, and collaboration. We develop in-house products with usage of modern, innovative technologies allowing for freedom to bring in own ideas and creating a real impact. We offer an exciting setting surrounded by industry talent, where you are encouraged to challenge the status quo while simultaneously getting the support you need to develop your desired skills and expertise.

title: Software Developer (Consultant, Graduate)
description:
**Come work with us** 




 Netlight strives to be a truly diverse, equitable and inclusive organization. Regardless of who you are, what personality, background, and experience you have, you enrich our culture through your values. Netlight’s purpose is to unleash full potential, realize great careers, and fulfill personal growth. To achieve this, we have a highly engaged network organization, where every employee gets a mentor, delivery coach and personal communities. The key to our continued success is trust and personal responsibility, diverse experiences, challenging opportunities and developing from personal values. Every Netlighter is an active part of building and shaping this culture, which leads to a clear correlation between personal growth and the growth of Netlight.
 



  





**About us** 




 Netlight provides a full range of premium IT-consulting services at the forefront of the digital industry and stands out for its product- and technology-independent expertise in a wide range of industries and clients. We are a network organization of more than 2 000 role models making aspiring digital leaders successful in their business-critical IT projects. Netlight has been awarded several times as top employer, as well as for growth, continued profitability and engagement for diversity, equity and equality within the IT industry. Today we are growing all across Europe, currently with more than 10 active international offices.
 



  





**What does it mean to be an IT Consultant in Software Development at Netlight?** 




 It will vary a lot between Netlighters as we, around the right person, will design a role together with you. You will be starting somewhere familiar and build from there. Our focus is working with new technologies and building new products and thus, many different technologies, frameworks, methods are available to learn. It is your call how your career at Netlight will look, ranging from which clients you will work with, what role you want to take (based on your personal experience, strengths, your personal interest) and how your relationship with your mentor/coach/EDGE networks/social networks will look like.
 



  





 As a consultant at Netlight, you will build the products, systems and technical solutions of today and tomorrow. This means that our consultants get the opportunity to help build and scale existing and new products and companies and also continuously learn and master a variety of technical tools. At Netlight, we will challenge you. Our clients will challenge you. You will challenge our clients. You will challenge us. We will grow together and unleash the potential in each other.
 



  





 Our projects are in the fields such as Fullstack, Backend, Frontend, Web Development, System Development, Cloud, Mobile Development, Architecture, Business Intelligence, Data Engineering, Data Science, DevOps, Infrastructure, Cyber Security, Scrum Master, Agile Coaching, Product Owner, UX-/UI-/Interaction Design and more.
 



  





**Minimum Qualifications** 



* Master Degree in Engineering
* Verbal and written fluency in English
* Work and project experience related to IT



  





**Preferred Qualifications** 



* Proven Track-record from previous positions (e.g. recognized achievements & deliveries)
* Advanced/Bilingual (B2-C2) Swedish/Norwegian/Danish



  





**Next step?** 




 We are always looking for new Netlighters, so feel free to apply if you meet the qualifications.
 



  





 We will get in touch within two weeks if we find that your profile and experiences are a match beyond the qualifications at this time.

title: Senior Backend Engineer
description:
**Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?** 




  





 Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, all while building trust everywhere. We're all about bringing you smart services with a big social impact, keeping you safe from fraud, harassment, scam calls or messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.
 



  




* Top 20 most downloaded apps globally, and world’s #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than
 **400 million** 
 active users per month.
* Founded in 2009, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.
* A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon, and Tel Aviv with high ambitions.



  





**We at the Identity team** 
 provide smooth and efficient activation and account handling for Truecaller users. Our mission is to secure authorized access to our platform for legitimate users only.
 



  





**As a Senior Backend Engineer** 
 in Identity, you will be working with a cross-functional team. You will be responsible for developing and maintaining Truecaller services catering to more than 368 million active users and you play an important part in defining and evolving the backend architecture. We are looking for an ambitious developer who has a passion for technology and a great will to learn and grow with us.
 



**The impact you will create:** 



* Design and develop high-volume, low-latency applications and cope with the challenge of working in a distributed environment.
* Operate mission-critical services, providing high availability (99.999%).
* Collaborate across business units and drive solutions.
* Explore new solutions and technologies.
* Build a scalable and reliable system.



  





**What you bring in:** 



* At least 5 years of software development experience with Scala or Java
* Experience in working with distributed systems, architecture, and patterns
* Experience of working with non-relational databases
* Good understanding of data structures and algorithms
* Good English skills, oral and written
* Mentoring/ Leadership skills



  





**It would be great if you also have:** 



* Scala, Lightbend stack
* Go language
* Play Framework
* Google Cloud Platform
* Reactive systems
* Cassandra
* Apache Kafka
* Kubernetes
* Docker



  





**Life at Truecaller -** 
 Behind the code:
 **https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/** 




  





**Sounds like your dream job?** 




  





 We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.
 



  





**This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.** 




  





**We only accept applications in English.** 




  





**What we offer:** 



* **A smart, talented and agile team:** 
 An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing and fun environment.
* **A great compensation package:** 
 Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, top-up parental leave, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership (SATS).
* **Do it your way** 
 : We work in-office on Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursdays with flexibility on the other days. You can enjoy 2 weeks working remotely from anywhere you want per year.
* **Office life:** 
 Enjoy your days with a daily free breakfast, a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages, or have fun with your colleagues in the playroom! As well, as exciting company parties and team activities such as Lab days, Running team, and Geek lunch!



  





**Come as you are:** 




 Truecaller is diverse, equal, and inclusive. We need a wide variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc.
 **All those things make you who you are, and that’s why we would love to meet you.**

title: Fullstack C# Career Program, Fall 2024, Stockholm
description:
Are you the next passionated hobby coder dreaming of becoming a Fullstack C# Developer in only 3 months? In that case - you fit the profile! ☕️🧂
   

  

**The Career Program**
 The SALT career program consists of 3 months intense full time coding (free of charge) and after successfully completing the training, our commercial team will connect you with an external tech team for 12 months as a SALT consultant.
 *Note that the first salary is paid out the month after the employment starts, it is therefore important that you can financially manage during the unpaid months during training.*
 Training start date:
 **November 1st**
**Tell me more!**
 Our career programs are entirely free of charge for motivated individuals who are ready to transform their
 *passion to profession* 
 and launch their career in tech. We believe in accelerated learning guided by our experienced and specialized instructors. This allows our developers to be fully equipped with all the tools to operate in any high-performing development team. Since our launch in 2018, we have conducted trainings in C#, Java and Javascript and graduated over 700 developers to be placed as consultants at various clients like SJ, Klarna and Trustly. After the consultancy year, 90% of our consultants are then being full-time employed at the company.
   

  

**Do you fit the profile?**
 We are looking for flexible and solution-oriented team players who want to accelerate quickly in their coding career by applying both your technical and soft skills in the consultancy role. What is unique about SALT is that the program allow hobby coders to fast-track a career within development, it is therefore
 *not* 
 required to have previously worked within tech.
   

  

**The requirements to be eligible are:**
* That you have been coding consistently for the last 4 months ≈ 15 hours per week
* You have prior work experience collaborating with others in a team
* Fluency in written and spoken English (the teaching language is in English)
* Hold a valid work permit for at least two years from the training start date
* That you are permanently located in or nearby Stockholm (the training is held on-site and can not be conducted remotely)


**APPLY NOW ✏️**
 The application is now
 **open** 
 and we are reviewing applications on an ongoing basis - so don’t procrastinate your dream of becoming a Full Stack Developer! Let's take that coding from
 *passion to profession 🚀*
***Last day** 
 to send in your application is 6th of September.*
*SALT is proud to be an equal employer that welcomes individuals of all genders, backgrounds and experiences. Join our team and be part of a company at the forefront of technology, that values and promotes wide diversity in the workplace. There is a profound sense of culture at SALT which is inclusive, open and dynamic.*

title: Senior Backend Developer (.NET)
description:
MAJORITY is a groundbreaking all-in-one digital financial service app that includes an FDIC-insured account, Visa® Prepaid card, money remittance, and international calling. We are built for migrants, by migrants.
   

  

 Global migration is a 21st-century reality. Whether people are following their dreams, love or new experiences, more and more of us are leaning towards new environments. Our purpose at MAJORITY is to empower the amazing, the brave, and the talented and help them achieve all of their ambitions.
   

  

 We believe that everyone deserves the same opportunity to succeed. Our mission is to provide migrants the tools to thrive in their new country.
   

  

 We are a diverse group of people from over 40 different countries that come together every day and we’re looking for others driven by the same desire to create meaningful products that bridge cultural and geographic distances
   

  

 MAJORITY is looking for a Senior Backend Engineer (.NET) to join its Engineering team. This is a full time position based in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

**About MAJORITY Backend**
 We’re a diverse bunch of skilled software developers with a passion for technical excellence. We strive to create innovative solutions to the many varied business problems that we are presented with. We work hard, deliver fast, are continually learning and have fun along the way. With a team of 8-10 backend developers we have built a system of 50 microservices with a million lines of C# code. Our business is growing fast and therefore so is our need to continually scale the system to meet the growing number or users and transactions.
   

  

* We have a modern technical platform. Everything .Net6, currently upgrading to .Net8.
* We have a microservice architecture, fully in C#. built on a solid foundation of base functionality like observability, DI, messaging etc.
* We have a high pace of development, shipping major new features frequently.
* We have leadership who understands and prioritizes technical work.
* We work in a domain (fintech) where correctness matters. We have very high uptime and correctness requirements. No payments should fail, and no cent can be lost!


****Key Responsibilities****
* Design, develop and maintain microservices built with .NET Core
* Write clean code with proper test coverage to support CI/CD workflows
* Contribute in design and architecture decisions within the team and across the organization
* Develop scalable, performant, and reliable systems
* Participate as a team member in agile deliveries
* Identify bugs and bottlenecks and resolve issues efficiently


****Requirements****
* You have 10+ years of experience working with modern backend development practices, with focus on .NET Frameworks and C#.
* You have good experience in cloud environments
* You have good experience working with SQL databases
* You are familiar with working with microservices & event driven architecture
* You have an understanding and interest in building and maintaining microservices running in Kubernetes
* You have experience with build tools and services such as AzureDevops


****About you****
* You're smart and you get stuff done
* You are ambitious, have a positive energy and always find a solution
* You can prioritize speed without neglecting quality and understand that speed is a competitive advantage
* You have a strong sense of ownership and accountability
* You are eager to learn from others and share what you know
* You dare to make decisions and learn from your mistakes
* You can reason through the trade-offs to make correct decisions for the benefit of the organization
* You have great communication skills in English


 Looking to be challenged? To work in an environment where your opinions are welcome and you’re constantly learning? To have a real impact on a meaningful project? To work with the latest technologies and to help shape the technology direction of the organization? Then we’d love to hear from you.
   

  

 We are MAJORITY. We are international, ambitious, kind, and inclusive. We believe in equal opportunity and value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: Software Developer (Consultant)
description:
**Come work with us** 




 Netlight strives to be a truly diverse, equitable and inclusive organization. Regardless of who you are, what personality, background, and experience you have, you enrich our culture through your values. Netlight’s purpose is to unleash full potential, realize great careers, and fulfill personal growth. To achieve this, we have a highly engaged network organization, where every employee gets a mentor, delivery coach and personal communities. The key to our continued success is trust and personal responsibility, diverse experiences, challenging opportunities and developing from personal values. Every Netlighter is an active part of building and shaping this culture, which leads to a clear correlation between personal growth and the growth of Netlight.
 



  





**About us** 




 Netlight provides a full range of premium IT-consulting services at the forefront of the digital industry and stands out for its product- and technology-independent expertise in a wide range of industries and clients. We are a network organization of more than 2 000 role models making aspiring digital leaders successful in their business-critical IT projects. Netlight has been awarded several times as top employer, as well as for growth, continued profitability and engagement for diversity, equity and equality within the IT industry. Today we are growing all across Europe, currently with more than 10 active international offices.
 



  





**What does it mean to be an IT Consultant in Software Development at Netlight?** 




 It will vary a lot between Netlighters as we, around the right person, will design a role together with you. You will be starting somewhere familiar. For example in web development? System development? Mobile Development? Data engineering? It is your call how your career at Netlight will look, ranging from which clients you will work with, what role you want to take (based on your personal experience, strengths, your personal interest) and how your relationship with your mentor/coach/EDGE networks/social networks will look like.
 



  





 As a consultant at Netlight, you will build the products, systems and technical solutions of today and tomorrow. This means that our consultants get the opportunity to help build and scale existing and new products and companies and also continuously learn and master a variety of technical tools. At Netlight, we will challenge you. Our clients will challenge you. You will challenge our clients. You will challenge us. We will grow together and unleash the potential in each other.
 



  





 Our projects are in the fields such as Backend Development, Frontend Development, Web Development, System Development, Cloud, Mobile Development, Architecture, Business Intelligence, Data Engineering, Data Science, DevOps, Infrastructure, Cyber Security, Scrum Master, Agile Coaching, Product Owner, UX-/UI-/Interaction Design and more.
 



  





**Minimum Qualifications** 



* Master Degree
* Verbal and written fluency in English
* 0,5-5 years of work experience related to IT (if you are a graduate, see our other active job ad)



  





**Preferred Qualifications** 



* Master Degree in Engineering or Technology
* Proven Track-record from previous positions (e.g. recognized achievements & deliveries)
* Advanced/Bilingual (B2-C2) Swedish/Norwegian/Danish



  





**Application** 




 We are always looking for new Netlighters, so feel free to apply if you meet the qualifications.
 



  





 We will get in touch within two weeks if we find that your profile and experiences are a match beyond the qualifications at this time.

title: Senior Backend Developer
description:
**Oneflow is a rapidly growing tech scale-up located in the heart of Stockholm. We have created a platform that automates the entire contract process from start to finish, all in one place. Turning clunky, static contracts into customer-oriented, digital contracts that feel like magic.** 




  





**The team** 




 You will be working with the Oneflow product, mostly written in Python and React, where we make several deployments each day and continuously improve our product. We are organising teams that like to discuss how to approach and break down problems together and value data-driven decisions. We want our developers to feel a strong sense of ownership and that their work really matters. We also want them to be involved in all steps of product development, from feature planning to release.
 



  





**Who you are** 




 As a Backend Developer at Oneflow, you have an interest in distributed systems and their scalability. You will mainly work with Python development and will both improve existing flows and create new ones as our product evolves, to meet customer needs while staying performant and reliable. We see that you have at least a few years of experience working with backends for web applications written in Python. If you are good at SQL queries and know some things about deployment pipelines that would definitely be an advantage.
 



  





**Your background** 



* Having worked at least a few years as a backend developer
* Experience of working with Python
* A good understanding of SQL databases
* An interest in REST API design
* Knowledge of some cloud APIs (AWS, Azure etc.)



  





**Technologies to work with** 



* Python
* Flask
* Celery
* MySQL
* Elasticsearch
* Docker



  





**We also value if you have an interest in either of these areas:** 



* Security
* Infrastructure
* Data science (statistics, machine learning, etc)
* Distributed logging



  





**How we work** 




 We want our employees to feel a strong sense of ownership, to feel like what they do really matters, and to be involved in all steps of product development, from feature planning to release. Our team and culture are built on this principle of inclusion and responsibility, which we see as crucial in building a great product.
 



 We strive for a truly agile development environment that promotes getting things done, rather than focusing too much on processes and enterprise tools. This means we typically work in short iterations, regularly going from conceptual discussions to shipped product features in a few weeks. We believe early and honest feedback is the best feedback, both internally and from our customers.
 



  





**Come work with us** 




 We value gender equality and diversity in organisation, so we strive for a team that reflects the diversity in today's society. At Oneflow we currently have 33 nationalities and are proud of an extremely diverse workplace. Our recruitment is based on competence.
 



 The recruitment process starts with an interview with Aleksandra from the Talent Acquisition team. After that, you will complete a personality and logic test, then prepare an assignment before your final interview with Sorin.
 



 We can’t wait to meet you! 🎉
 



 Visit our website for more information about our product and Oneflow. Visit our blog for more information about our culture and future colleagues. 💜

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Join SeenThis as a Senior Software Engineer and drive the development of one of our newest products. It is currently being rolled out to a few key partners, and we are now continuing development and scaling to more. We are looking for a developer who is excited about scaling this product to the next level. It would be great if you wanted to be involved in talking to clients, brainstorming ideas, and implementing and packaging it together with the rest of the team.
 



  





 In this role, you will initially focus on our new product and scale it globally. As SeenThis continuously develops new products, you might get the opportunity to work on different projects, in different teams, that align with your ambitions as well as business needs.
 



  





**About the Role:** 




  





 We are looking for a developer who has experience in taking products to market and scaling them. We hope you have been working closely with clients to understand their needs and enjoy working in an environment with rapid change and an agile mindset. Since this role involves many contact points, we feel that the person who fits this role truly is a people person.
 



 You are a developer with at least 5 years of experience who is used to working across the JavaScript stack with modern technologies. If you have experience coaching others or leading technical teams, we see that as a plus since this role could develop into one with more leadership responsibilities in the future.
 



  





*Proficiency in Swedish and English languages is a requirement for this role.* 




  





**About SeenThis:** 




  





 Since 2017, SeenThis has revolutionized screen experiences with our adaptive streaming technology, maximizing performance and minimizing emissions. Serving billions of streams for over 2,500 brands in 50+ countries, we are reshaping the internet for good. Our success stems from our people.
 



  





 Our team of 120+ employees works globally from offices in Stockholm (HQ), Oslo, London, Helsinki, Paris, Singapore, Hong Kong, New York, and Sydney. We’re rapidly expanding across all areas and constantly seeking new colleagues.
 



  





 Do you want to be part of our journey, where we live our values
 *Dare to discover, Own it,* 
 and
 *Win together?* 




  





 Join SeenThis!
 



  





**Application:** 




 We look forward to your application! Please note that we conduct background checks on all new SeenThis team members, in compliance with our customers, to protect business-critical information.
 



 If you have any questions please, contact Ronja Hultkrantz, Talent Acquisition Manager & HR at ronja@seenthis.se

title: .NET Software Engineer, .NET 8, C#, Azure, JavaScript, Agile – Stockholm
description:

 (Tech stack: .NET Software Engineer, .NET 8, ASP.NET, C#, React, Angular 17, Microservices, Vue.js, TypeScript, Azure, Web API 2, Agile, SQL Server 2022, Programmer, Full Stack Developer, Architect, .NET Software Engineer, Urgent)

They have been extremely picky about assembling a team of smart, humble people who are passionate about creating amazing products. They work in an agile manner and believe strongly that small cross-functional teams empowered to make decisions and move fast is the best way to work. This is an unbeatable opportunity for .NET Software Engineer who hope to work on and deliver world class software in a friendly, fun, and innovative environment.
 



  





 The ideal .NET Software Engineer candidates should have strong experience with: .NET, .NET Core / ASP.NET MVC, C# and SQL Server. Our client will provide you with industry recognised training into: .NET 8, JavaScript, React, Angular 17, Microservices, MongoDB, Vue.js, TypeScript, Azure, AWS, Web API 2, Entity Framework, Node.js, Elasticsearch, Agile, TDD, BDD, Scrum, Kanban and SQL Server 2022.

* Generous stock option plan.

title: Lead Developer – Tech Lab
description:
At If, we believe that research, development, and experimentation are excellent ways to gain experience and learn firsthand how to utilize technology to create better services for our customers and explore new business opportunities. We also recognize that it is challenging for every team across our 1,100 people strong IT organization to dedicate their resources to exploring some of the more radical ideas.
 



  





**About Tech Lab** 




 Tech Lab is our internal research and development team. We are a small team of engineers with dedicated capacity to work with innovative ideas sourced from all areas of our organization. We research to find answers, create proof-of-concepts to explore viability, and join forces with other teams to build novel solutions for production use. More importantly, we work as a catalyst for innovation in the company through collaboration and knowledge sharing. Our team is passionate, diverse, and driven by curiosity. We believe that different perspectives boost innovation and strengthen our working culture.
 



  





**About The Role** 




 We are looking for a person with strong software development skills and ample experience combined with a true interest in sharing knowledge with others, a great cross-team collaboration facilitator with a pragmatic mindset – someone who is proactive and knows what it takes for a team to get things done and have fun along the way.
 



  





**Key responsibilities** 
**include:** 



* implementing ideas in code with your fellow teammates.
* designing solution architecture.
* facilitating ways of working within our own team and in new project constellations.
* collaborating with different stakeholders across the organization.



  





**Technology Stack** 




 The tech stack you would be working with is whatever the team finds best suited to solve the problem at hand. With that being said, some tech is more common than others at If, so proven experience in the following areas will be favorable:
 



  




* Azure Cloud and everything that comes with it, from Infrastructure-as-Code to optimization and monitoring.
* Azure DevOps and Git for CI/CD and Application Lifecycle Management.
* C# / .NET development.
* Web development with JS/TS and modern front-end frameworks.
* Python & Databricks.



  





 More importantly, you should be open to learning and adopting new technologies and probably consider yourself more of a generalist than a specialist.
 



  





**Who are you?** 




 To succeed in this role, we think you are curious with a solution-oriented mindset – not afraid to try and learn new things. We also love having discussions and figuring out things together; therefore, we value a collaborative team mentality with a willingness to share knowledge and be open to giving and receiving feedback on work. Lastly, you should feel comfortable working in different team setups since we collaborate with many different teams across If.
 



  





 This is a senior position, and you should have at least 5 years of professional software development experience and a bachelor’s degree (or higher) in a relevant field of study. Equivalent experience can substitute for the lack of an academic degree. If is a Nordic and Baltic company, thus the working language is English. Additionally, proficiency in a Nordic language is favorable.
 



  





**Hybrid work** 




 We apply a hybrid work approach. You are welcome in the office anytime, of course, but at a minimum, you should be prepared to come in a couple of days per week when a collaborative setting is more beneficial (like whiteboard sessions, pair programming, etc.). We adapt to the current initiative we are working on; some projects do require more physical presence than others.
 



  





**Additional Facts** 




**Application deadline:** 
 31th of July, due to summer vacation we will not be able to handle your application before the deadline of the application. Candidate selection and interviews will be done continuously until the position is filled.
 



**To apply for this position:** 
 Please attach your CV and answer the questions in the following steps in the recruiting system
 



**Work location:** 
 Bergshamra/Stockholm
 



**Start:** 
 As soon as possible/by agreement.
 



  





 For more information, please contact Elin Hellenius, Talent Acquisition Partner, elin.hellenius@if.se
 



  





 Final candidates will undergo a background check before a job offer can be presented. In addition to references, candidates can also be checked via the internet and social media.
 







**About Us** 








***We are If. Our purpose is to give people confidence today to shape their tomorrow.***




*To make this possible, trust is our backbone. We stay ahead and challenge ourselves to grow. And we always put our hearts into it – because it takes more than bright minds to make brilliant things happen.* 




*We are the leading insurance company in the Nordics/Baltics and a stable employer with 7,900 dedicated professionals. But most importantly, we are protectors of people, enablers of companies and encouragers of dreams. With our joint force of expertise and engagement we always stand by our customers’ side. Giving them the security and the confidence to be curious, explore new worlds, start new businesses and live their lives.* 




*We are an equal opportunity employer, convinced that a diverse and inclusive work culture boosts innovation and the growth of intellectual capital in many ways. It doesn’t matter who you are, where you come from, or what you look like. It is the different perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences each of us have and share, that will make a difference.* 




*Come and join us!*
