title: Supply Chain Planner to international company!
description:
Are you a strategic planner with a passion for logistics? We are now looking for a Supply Chain Planner who wants to take the opportunity to become a key player in a global organization and develop with them. The start for this position is immediately - welcome with your application!
 


 Apply here!
 
  

**City :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Job Category :**
 Warehousing / Logistics
 



  

**Extent :**
 Full time, time-limited assignment of 6 months
 



  

**Start date :**
 ASAP
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Staffing
   




**About the role**

 As a Supply Chain Planner, your main responsibility is to plan, coordinate, and optimize our packed goods operations at our clients European hub. You will ensure cost-effectiveness and high customer service by managing production planning for drums and IBCs, participating in improvement projects, and assisting the Head of Supply Chain Operations with cost follow-up and invoice management. Additionally, you will handle stock reconciliation and maintain statistical reporting databases. You will also play an active role in matching supply and demand within the NSP Supply Chain Department along with other stakeholders.
   

 On a personal level we are seeking for applicants who lives the companies values of dedication, cooperation and proactivity. The candidate has a good basic understanding of logistics and planning, is structured, positive, service minded, resilient, open to changes, flexible and has good social, influencing and diplomatic skills.
 


  


  

**You are offered**



  

  
* A challenging position in an international setting and a highly motivated team.
  
* The opportunity of making an impact and work closely with dedicated colleagues around the world.
  
* The opportunity to develop within Supply Chain Management.
  

  


**We are looking for**
  
* Academic degree, preferably in logistics and/or economics.
  
* Operational background experience. Previous work experience in logistics or the process industry, particularly within the chemical sector or any other company handling bulk liquids, is considered a valuable merit.
  
* Fluent in english. Knowledge in the Swedish or Dutch language is a valuable merit.
  
* Solid knowledge in IT and Microsoft Office applications, especially Excel
  


  


  

**To succeed in the role, your personal skills are:**



  

  
* Structured
  
* Positive and service minded
  
* Good communication, diplomatic and social skills
  
* Self-sufficient
  


  

  

**Our recruitment process**
  


 This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and it is our client’s wish that all questions regarding the position is directed to Academic Work.
 


  


 Our selection process is continuous and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the next phase. The process includes two tests: one personality test and one cognitive test. The tests are tools to find the right talent for the right position, to enable equality, diversity, and a fair process.
   




**Become a part of Academic Work**

 When you apply to this job, you are becoming one of many consultants at Academic Work. This means that not only will you gain fantastic benefits, but also a team of consultant managers to support you through your career with us.
 


 Read more about Academic Work
   

**Do you have questions about this job?**

 Molly Rytter or a colleague in the recruitment team will gladly answer you on stv5@academicwork.se Please specify advert-ID in your email: 15105859

title: Senior Engineer/Tech Lead in Unit Master Data Production – Solna/Hybrid
description:
The IT department at PostNord consists of a dedicated team responsible for driving innovation and delivering high-quality software solutions. Our mission is to support the organization's strategic goals by developing scalable and efficient systems. We foster a collaborative and inclusive culture where every team member's contribution is valued.
   

  

**Job Duties**
 As the Senior Engineer/Tech Lead for the Geographical Information Master, you will be coding and play a pivotal role in leading the Tech development and enhancement of PostNord Geographical Master Data. With the most part of PostNord systems consuming GIM Master data and Nordic Countries using the GIM UI your responsibilities will include making sure that the application is using the right software and that it is updated accordingly. You will collaborate closely with PO, Team, Senior Master Data Architect and Enterprise Master Data Architect making sure GIM system is developed and maintained correctly.
   

  

**We are looking for you who have** 
**Experience: (Need-to-have)**
* Experience in managing application with Event driven architecture.
* Proven experience (3+ years) as an Engineer or similar role like Tech Lead.
* Experience in building microservices
* Understanding of container orchestration platforms and experience deploying production software
* Solid understanding of software architecture, design patterns, and best practices
* Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or GCP
* Strong problem-solving skills and ability to think critically
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
* Knowledge and experience working with GO
* Experience with Agile methodologies and DevOps practices


**Meritorious experience: (Nice-to-have)**
* Experience in working with logistics industry specifically around Master Data and Geographical Data.
* Strong understanding of PostNord Geographical Data, particularly within the Nordic region.


**We believe you are a person that is:**
* Thorough, analytical, and quick to learn new systems
* Inclusive, structured, and responsible in your working style
* Able to handle stressful situations and prioritize tasks independently
* Communicative and easy to collaborate with, building and nurturing long-term relationships


**We offer you**
**Benefits**
 We offer a variety of work in an international environment with constantly new challenges and quick decisions. Here you have opportunities to develop creative solutions and work in a prestige-free group where we jointly help to reach our goals. PostNord is one of Sweden's largest workplaces and we offer safe employment conditions and benefits. In addition to the benefits mentioned above, we offer:
   

  

* Hybrid workplace with a Nordic and dynamic environment.  Watch the video about our office.
* Great development opportunities
* Great insurance and occupational pension terms
* Wellness allowance & opportunity to train at Arken's gym and indoor swimming pool
* Employee benefits through  PostNord Plus - PostNord´s own personnel foundation


**We make everyday life easier**
 PostNord is the leading supplier of communication and logistics solutions to, from, and within the Nordic region. We ensure the provision of a postal service to households and businesses in Sweden and Denmark. We aim to make everyday life easier and more sustainable for everyone who lives and works in the Nordic region. We are in a constant transformation and work consistently to develop both our offer and our employees, all to achieve our vision of being The favorite carrier of the Nordics. We are PostNord - a fantastic company to work and grow with. Read more at postnord.com
   

  

**Apply**
 We look forward to receiving your application!
   

  

 If you have any questions or concerns, please contact manager Robin Lindfors on robin.lindfors1@postnord.com
   

  

 Don't wait to submit your application as we go through the applications on an ongoing basis.
   

  

 For union representatives, visit:  Facklig kontakt | PostNord
   

  

 We are looking forward to hearing from you!

title: Manager, Account Management
description:
**Our Purpose**
 We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a culture of inclusion for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.
   

  

**Title And Summary**
 Manager, Account Management
   

  

 The Manager, Account Management is a key role in the Nordics & Baltic market as we continue to build on our success locally. In this role you will be responsible for managing relationships with our Channel Partners (Acquirers, PSPs and Processors).
   

  

 This position reports to the Head of Channel Partners in the Nordics & Baltics. The team is responsible for driving Mastercard business and relationship with Channel Partners (Acquirers, PSPs and Processors) across the Nordics and Baltics.
   

  

**Role**
* You will be responsible for further develop our success within the Channel Partner segment by developing strong and enduring relationships across all managed customers.
* You are expected to understand and own the customer business strategies, identify opportunities that drive business growth and deliver against sales targets for the wide range of products and services provided by Mastercard.
* You are expected to manage, build and grow the business relationship with the entire organization of the customer.
* You are expected to execute Mastercard’s strategy including acceptance quality and growth and acceptance infrastructure upgrades like EMV adoption within the managed account base.


**Accountabilities**
* Act as the primary point of contact between Mastercard and the customer by ensuring strategic alignment and maximum mutual success in achieving goals and objectives.
* Monitor and ensure the highest level of customer satisfaction.
* Own and develop the annual and long-term planning cycle / process including develop and execute against a robust sales pipeline.
* Develop / execute Channel Partner strategy to enhance revenue and volume growth and our relationship across all managed customers.
* Successfully manage the financial performance by ensuring that all target metrics are met.
* Develop as well as manage relationships between internal Mastercard partners including business development, marketing and communication, market development, customer delivery, product, Advisors, legal, compliance, security, etc. in order to ensure cross-functional alignment and correct support for the customer.


**Experience, Skills & Education**
* Demonstrated success in customer/sales roles, development and execution experience, including experience in negotiations/contract management.
* Experience in identifying strategic opportunities and of managing multiple stakeholders.
* Superior interpersonal and communications skills.
* Demonstrated revenue management and P&L experience.
* Strong analytical and diagnostic capabilities.
* Self starter, independent operator and highly proactive – does not wait to be directed.
* Flexible and open-minded when it comes to taking on a variety of projects.


**Corporate Security Responsibility**
 All activities involving access to Mastercard assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and, therefore, it is expected that every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security and must:
   

  

* Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices;
* Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed;
* Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and
* Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.

title: Förändringsledare Coach
description:
*Är du en driven förändringsledare med en passion för samarbete och arbetssätt? Hos oss på LF Fondliv söker vi en engagerad ledare som vågar testa nya idéer med tilltro till organisationens förmågor. Vi värdesätter roligt och stöttande arbetsklimat där framgångar delas och kunskap sprids. Med god insikt i organisationens behov och affärens dynamik, arbetar vi tillsammans för helheten och strävar alltid efter att prestera på topp.*
*Om du är nyfiken, nytänkande och vill bidra till vårt samhälle, samtidigt som du leder med driv och engagemang, då är du den vi söker! Bli en del av vårt team och hjälp oss forma framtiden. och bidra till vår utveckling mot Ett Ledande Fondliv. Låter det intressant? Läs vidare!*
**Om jobbet**
 Som förändringsledare hos oss kommer du att utveckla våra förmågor att hantera förändring och genomföra Fondliv och Länsförsäkringars övergripande mål och vision. Du kommer att analysera och agera inom de områden som kräver förändring. Ditt arbete kommer att till största delen bestå i att stötta medarbetare på alla nivåer i förändringsresan. Genom involvering skapas tydlighet, engagemang och förståelse för det värde vi ska uppnå och förändringarna som krävs för att ta oss dit.
   

  

 Du kommer att arbeta nära med ledningsgrupper, avdelningar och team för att säkerställa att förändringsinitiativ genomförs smidigt och effektivt. Genom att stödja och coacha organisationen och individerna genom förändringsprocessen, kommer du att främja en kultur av samarbete och delaktighet. För att säkerställa att förändringsinitiativ ger önskade resultat, kommer du tillsammans med andra att utvärdera deras effekter och justera strategier vid behov.
   

  

**Dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden:** 
  

  

* Strategisk Planering och Implementering:
+ Utveckla och genomföra förändringsstrategier som är i linje med företagets övergripande mål och vision.
+ Identifiera och analysera områden som kräver förändring och utveckla handlingsplaner för att adressera dessa.

* Kommunikation och Engagemang:
+ Hjälpa chefer och ledare att kommunicera tydligt och effektivt.
+ Skapa engagemang och förståelse för förändringsprocessen genom att involvera medarbetare på alla nivåer.

* Samarbete och Teamledning:
+ Arbeta nära med individer och team för att säkerställa att förändringsinitiativ genomförs smidigt och effektivt.
+ Stödja och coacha medarbetare genom förändringsprocessen, främja en kultur av samarbete och delaktighet.

* Utvärdering och Justering:
+ Utvärdera effekterna av förändringsinitiativ och justera strategier vid behov för att säkerställa önskade resultat.
+ Använda data och feedback för att kontinuerligt förbättra processer och metoder.


**Vem är du?**
**Agila Arbetssätt:**
* Praktisk Erfarenhet: Bevisad erfarenhet av att tillämpa agila principer i praktiken på strategisk, taktisk och operativ nivå.
* Flexibilitet och Anpassningsförmåga: Förmåga att snabbt anpassa sig till förändrade förutsättningar och att driva förändring i en dynamisk miljö.
* Teamutveckling: Erfarenhet av att utveckla och coacha agila team, främja en kultur av kontinuerlig förbättring och självorganisering.
* Kommunikation och Transparens: Stark kommunikationsförmåga för att säkerställa tydlighet och transparens i alla led av utvecklingsprocessen.


**Affärsutveckling och Verksamhetsutveckling:**
* Strategisk Förmåga: Förmåga att utveckla och implementera långsiktiga affärsstrategier som driver tillväxt och innovation.
* Medarbetarfokus: Lätt att ta till sig och förstå LFs behov i förändringsresan och förmåga att utveckla en ökad kundcentrering.
* Analytisk Kompetens: Stark förmåga att förstå var vi befinner oss på föröndringsresan och anpassa metoder och arbetssätt utifrån situationen och identifiera hur vi kan förverkliga affärsmöjligheter.
* Resultatorientering: Erfarenhet av att sätta upp och nå affärsmål, samt att mäta och utvärdera affärsresultat.
* Tvärfunktionellt Samarbete: Förmåga att arbeta över olika kompetenser och funktioner för att driva verksamhetsförbättringar och effektiviseringar.


**Kvalifikationer och Egenskaper:**
* Erfarenhet: Minst 5 års erfarenhet av förändringsledning eller liknande roll, gärna inom en komplex och dynamisk organisation. Arbetat med teamutveckling på flera nivåer.
* Utbildning: Relevant högskoleutbildning inom exempelvis företagsekonomi, management eller organisationsutveckling.
* Ledarskap: Stark ledarskapsförmåga med erfarenhet av att leda och inspirera team genom förändringsprocesser.
* Kommunikation: Utmärkta kommunikations- och presentationsfärdigheter, med förmåga att anpassa budskap till olika målgrupper.
* Analytisk Förmåga: Förmåga att analysera data och trender för att informera beslut och strategier.


**Om oss**
 Du välkomnas till avdelningen Transformation och IT inom affärsenhet Fondliv och här hos oss på Länsförsäkringar får du möjlighet att arbeta i en dynamisk och innovativ miljö där vi värdesätter samarbete, nytänkande och engagemang. Vi erbjuder en arbetsplats där du kan växa, lära och bidra till att forma framtiden för både vårt företag och vårt samhälle. Om du är redo att ta nästa steg i din karriär och leda förändring med mod, tilltro och driv, då vill vi höra från dig!
   

  

**Mer information**
*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*
**Sista ansökningsdag: 2024-08-31**
 Rekryteringsprocessen kommer ta en kort paus under semestern och vi kommer att återkoppla till alla sökanden i augusti. Tack för er förståelse och ha en riktigt bra sommar

title: Integrationsutvecklare med ansvar för API gateway till Finansinspektionen
description:
Är du systemutvecklare och sugen på en spännande digitaliseringsresa? Kom till oss på Finansinspektionen (FI) och bidra med din kompetens! Vi är ett engagerat it-team som arbetar agilt för att leverera tjänster till FI:s medarbetare, allmänheten och företag under vår tillsyn. Nu förstärker vi vår it-organisation.
   

  

**Om jobbet**
 Som integrationsutvecklare på avdelning Arkitektur och it-säkerhet ingår du i ett agilt team och arbetar med nyutveckling, vidareutveckling och förvaltning av de integrationer och komponenter som ingår i integrations teamets ansvarsområde. Du arbetar primärt med integrationsutveckling och plattformskonfiguration samt förvaltning av vår API gateway.
   

  

 Arbetet genomförs i nära samarbete med verksamheten, övriga agila it-team samt externa leverantörer. I rollen som integrationsutvecklare deltar du i teamets ceremonier som till exempel standups, refinements och sprintplaneringar. Du arbetar med hela kedjan från krav, design och arkitektur till utveckling, test och driftsättning.
   

  

**Din utbildning och erfarenhet**
 Vi söker dig som
   

  

* har kunskap och erfarenhet av att arbeta med en marknadsledande API gateway(utveckling, konfiguration och administration) samt har erfarenhet av förvaltning
* har erfarenhet att designa och arbeta fram lösningar för externa och interna api:er samt har erfarenhet att stötta utvecklingsprojekt att produktionssätta API:er via en API gateway
* har erfarenhet av SFTP (Secure File Transfer Protocol)
* har erfarenhet av integrationsutveckling och it-integrationsarkitektur i .Net, Linux och Kubernetes
* har erfarenhet av Microsoft SQL Server, javascript och python
* uttrycker dig mycket väl på svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift
* Har akademisk utbildning inom civilingenjör, systemvetenskap eller liknande.


 Det är meriterande om du
   

  

* har kunskap i Nodinite
* har kunskap inom SSIS (utveckling och administration)
* har erfarenhet av IIS och WCF, XML och XSL/XSLT
* har erfarenhet av BizTalk Server-plattformen
* har erfarenhet av klustrade tjänster och miljöer
* har erfarenhet av GraphQL
* har erfarenhet av agilt arbete och/eller SAFe-ramverket.


**Om dig**
 I det här jobbet behöver du
   

  

* bidra till ett gott samarbete
* planera, organisera och prioritera ditt arbete på ett effektivt sätt
* ha en god analytisk förmåga och kunna lösa komplexa uppgifter
* ta egna initiativ.


**Om FI**
 FI bidrar till ett stabilt finansiellt system, välfungerande marknader, en hållbar utveckling och ett högt skydd för konsumenter. Vi erbjuder dig att arbeta med samhällsviktiga uppgifter, där du är med och påverkar den finansiella marknaden.
   

  

 På FI arbetar cirka 600 personer och våra värderingar präglas av att vi är engagerade, beslutsamma, målinriktade och hjälpsamma. Vår arbetsplats ligger centralt i Stockholm. Det finns även möjlighet att delvis arbeta på distans. För mer information om vår organisation: https://www.fi.se/sv/om-fi/organisation/
   

  

 Verksamhetsområde It leder det strategiska digitaliseringsarbetet, driver innovation och ansvarar för internationell koordinering inom it. Vårt uppdrag är brett och vårt ansvarsområde sträcker sig från löpande drift, support och säkerhet till utveckling och förvaltning av våra system, projektledning, arkitektur, upphandlingar samt leverantörsstyrning. Här jobbar cirka 100 personer, fördelade på sex avdelningar och en stab.
   

  

**Bra att veta**
 Vi baserar vår rekrytering på kompetens. Det innebär att vi noggrant definierar vilka kvalifikationer som efterfrågas och sedan utgår från dem genom hela rekryteringsprocessen.
   

  

 Vi arbetar aktivt för mångfald och likabehandling och välkomnar därför medarbetare med olika erfarenheter, bakgrunder och kompetenser.
   

  

 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
   

  

 Arbetspsykologiska tester ingår i rekryteringsprocessen.
   

  

 På FI arbetar vi aktivt för att vara en attraktiv arbetsgivare där du som medarbetare trivs och utvecklas. Läs mer om hur det är att jobba på FI och vad vi erbjuder: https://www.fi.se/sv/om-fi/lediga-jobb/vi-erbjuder/
   

  

 En anställning på FI kan innebära att säkerhetsprövning och registerkontroll görs enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen.
   

  

**Sök jobbet**
 Välkommen med din ansökan som ska innehålla cv, personligt brev och relevanta intyg eller examensbevis.
   

  

 Vi avböjer all hjälp med rekrytering och annonsering.
   

  

 Urval och intervjuer kommer att genomföras efter sista ansökningsdagen.
   

  

**Anställningsform:**
 Tillsvidareanställning som inleds med sex månaders provanställning. Tillträde enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

**Omfattning:** 
 Heltid
   

  

**Kontaktperson**
 Helena Lejonklou, avdelningschef, 08-408 986 23 eller Alfred Karlsson, Hr-specialist, 08-408 984 93.
   

  

**Sista ansökningsdag** 
 2024-08-07

title: Service Operations Manager
description:
*Är du en erfaren ledare inom IT-drift och nätövervakning? Har du förmågan att bygga och utveckla starka driftteam? Vi söker dig som är redo att leda förbättringar och säkerställa högsta tillgänglighet för våra produkter. Bli en del av vårt växande internationella team, där varje dag är en möjlighet att bidra till något meningsfullt.* 




  





 Som Network Operations Manager inom vår business unit Smart Alarms kommer du att leda ett team på 9 medarbetare och ansvara för två huvudsakliga funktioner: övervakningsfunktionen (NOC) och andra linjens tekniska support. Teamet är navet vid incidenter som påverkar både interna och externa kunder.
 



  





 Ditt uppdrag innebär att kontinuerligt driva förbättringsarbetet inom drift. Du kommer säkerställa efterlevnad av ITIL-processer (Incident-, Problem- och Change Management) samt säkra hög tillgänglighet och kvalitet för våra larmtjänster och produktionsplattformar.
 



  





 Du kommer att fungera som en brygga mellan flera intressenter, inkluderat applikationsägare, sälj och kundservice. Detta i en verksamhet med starkt fokus på hög tillgänglighet och utmärkt kundnöjdhet. Dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden:
 


* Ansvar för Incident Management, Problem Management och Change Management (ITILv4).
* Uppföljning av förbättringsarbetet hos både interna och externa leverantörer.
* Ledning och utveckling av team med fokus på tjänsteövervakning och kundfokus.
* Utveckling av medarbetarnas kompetens och säkerställande av kontinuerligt lärande och utveckling.
* Bygga starka relationer med andra avdelningar för att säkerställa en kundupplevelse i toppklass.



  





 NOC-teamet agerar Incident Manager dygnet runt, vilket innebär att en ambulerande beredskapsfunktion ska finnas tillgänglig.
 



  





**Om dig:** 




 Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av att bygga och utveckla en driftorganisation och som tar dig an utmaningar med självförtroende och målmedvetenhet. Du är en trygg ledare med minst 3 års erfarenhet av IT-drift och nätövervakning i en ledande position och i en affärskritisk miljö. För att passa i den här rollen tror vi också att du:
 


* Har teoretiska och praktiska kunskaper inom ITIL eller andra relevanta ramverk, utbildningar eller applikationer.
* Har utbildning inom IT/nätverk eller motsvarande (meriterande).
* Har minst 5 års erfarenhet från branscher som IT eller telekommunikation.
* Har förmågan att navigera komplexa situationer och samtidigt upprätthålla en hög servicenivå.
* Är en lyhörd och inspirerande ledare med förmåga att ta beslut, hålla fast vid mål samt motivera och engagera dina medarbetare.
* Är engagerad i att skapa en kundcentrerad kultur och har en skarp blick för att identifiera och utnyttja förbättringsmöjligheter.



  





 Dina kontakter kommer att vara svenska och internationella, så du behöver behärska både svenska och engelska mycket väl i tal och skrift.
 



  





**Vi erbjuder** 




 Våra anställda är vår största tillgång! För oss på AddSecure är det av stor vikt att bygga en kultur där våra medarbetare trivs och vill prestera.
 



  





 Vi kan alla göra skillnad! Så om du söker en arbetsgivare som uppmuntrar dig att vara dig själv och att ha roligt på jobbet, där ditt arbete bidrar till en säkrare, smartare och mer hållbar värld, då kan AddSecure vara din nästa arbetsplats. Bli en del av vårt växande internationella team, där varje dag är en möjlighet att bidra till något meningsfullt.
 



  





 Vårt NOC-team är placerat på vårt huvudkontor, och den här tjänstens karaktär innebär att primärt arbete på kontoret. Vi sitter i trevliga lokaler vid Telefonplan i Stockholm och du kommer välkomnas till ett gäng som trivs på jobbet och har kul tillsammans!
 



  





**Om processen** 




 Vill du vara med på vår resa? Sök tjänsten genom att bifoga ditt CV och besvara några frågor.
 



 För mer information är du välkommen att kontakta, Daniel Rylin, 070-166 3185.
 



  





 Vi arbetar kompetensbaserat genom hela processen och det inkluderar arbetspsykologiska tester, intervjuer och referenstagning. Vi utför bakgrundskontroller av alla våra anställda, och du måste vara berättigad att arbeta i Sverige. Denna tjänst är säkerhetsklassad och en säkerhetsprövning kommer att genomföras i enlighet med säkerhetsskyddslagen.
 



  





**AddSecure** 
 är en ledande europeisk leverantör av säkra IoT-uppkopplingar och end-to-end lösningar. Vi hjälper våra kunder att optimera sin verksamhet, skapa affärsvärde och säkra viktiga funktioner. Våra lösningar inom pålitlig övervakad larmöverföring uppfyller kraven för att övervaka larmsignaler med högsta säkerhetsnivå. Vårt arbete gör skillnad och räddar liv.

title: Swedish Speaking Jobs In Greece - Fully Paid Relocation Package
description:
Patrique Mercier Recruitment, a leading recruitment agency specializing in multilingual job placements, is currently offering exciting opportunities for Swedish-speaking individuals to work in Greece. These positions come with a fully paid relocation package, providing you with the opportunity to experience a new culture while working for top companies.
   

  

 As a Swedish-speaking professional, you will have the chance to work in various industries, including customer service, IT support, sales, and more. Your role will involve providing excellent support to Swedish-speaking customers, whether it's resolving technical issues, delivering exceptional customer service, or contributing to sales efforts.
   

  

 Patrique Mercier Recruitment has a proven track record of successfully connecting highly qualified candidates with top companies across different sectors. Our comprehensive recruitment process ensures that we find the perfect match between candidates and employers.
   

  

 If you are fluent in Swedish, possess excellent communication skills, and are enthusiastic about working in Greece, this is a unique opportunity to advance your career and explore new horizons.
   

  

**Requirements**
* Fluency in Swedish, with excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Possess relevant experience in customer service, IT support, sales, or other related fields
* Strong problem-solving and decision-making skills
* Ability to provide exceptional customer service or achieve sales targets
* Flexibility to adapt to different industries and work in a fast-paced environment
* Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to work effectively in a team
* Willingness to relocate to Greece
* Valid European passport or ID


**Benefits**
* Private Health Insurance
* Training & Development
* Performance Bonus
* 2 Extra Salaries Per Year
* Fully Paid Training
* Great Salary
* Fully Paid Relocation Package ( flight, transfer and hotel )

title: Junior SAP Basis Administrator
description:
Om tjänsten
   

  

**You would like to make a difference and work together with us on our big target to get fossil free within one generation?**
 On the current journey of Vattenfall towards S/4 HANA our SAP Basis Team is responsible for the management of an international technical SAP system landscape running in the cloud as well as on premise.
   

  

 For the SAP Basis Team, part of Vattenfall IT we are now looking for an ambitious
 **Junior SAP Basis Administrator** 
 in Berlin, Stockholm or Amsterdam
   

  

**What will you do?**
 As a Junior SAP Basis Administrator you will take responsibility of the configuration, monitoring, tuning, and troubleshooting of the technology stack like SAP application and underlaying database.
   

  

**Your tasks and responsibilities:**
* Assist in the management of Vattenfall’s international SAP system landscape, including both cloud and on-premise environments
* Support configuration, monitoring, tuning, and troubleshooting of the SAP technology stack and underlying databases
* Participate in software upgrades, system installations, configuration, and support package installations
* Assist in HANA database administration and user authentication/security access management
* Contribute to the planning and management of technical projects and upgrades
* Support secure operation and setup of SAP landscapes
* Assist in SAP Basis and database workload analysis and performance tuning
* Work with integration teams to connect surrounding systems based on current security standards
* Support the maintenance and setup of SAP High-Availability solutions
* Basic database administration (Oracle, HANA)
* Gain knowledge of data-center infrastructure, including hardware and software (operating systems/UNIX and Linux)
* Participate in on-call duty rotation


**Location**
 Berlin
 **,** 
 Stockholm or Amsterdam
   

  

 Din bakgrund
   

  

**Who are you?**
 As our
 **SAP Basis Administrator** 
 you bring strong communication skills, an open mindset and solid problem solving skills.
   

  

**Next to this you bring:**
* University degree (Bachelor’s) or equivalent technical qualification/experience
* Basic understanding of SAP software architecture and landscape design
* Fundamental knowledge of SAP technologies
* Ability to cooperate with team members and customers
* English language skills - verbal and written
* Swedish language skills could be helpful but not mandatory


 Mer information
   

  

**What We Offer**
 At Vattenfall we promote smart working. Meaning you can easily combine work life with your private situation to ensure a healthy work life balance. We are convinced that the pursuit of diversity helps to build a profitable, efficient and attractive company. Therefore we are looking for a harmonious balance of employees in terms of gender, age and ethnic and cultural backgrounds.
   

  

**More Information**
 Please apply before
 **August 11th 2024** 
 . For additional specific technical information about this vacancy announcement please contact Davyd Teske (Manager SAP-Basis) (davyd.teske@vattenfall.de). For further information regarding the recruitment process you are welcome to contact recruiter
 **Marius Gläßge** 
 (marius.glaessge@vattenfall.de) or +49 30 81822004.
   

  

 Trade union representatives in Sweden (IT) are Sofi Wadström (Akademikerna), Inger Strandberg (Unionen), Christer Gustafsson (Ledarna), Lennart Bengtsson (SEKO). To get in contact with the representatives, please call Vattenfall´s switchboard +46 8 739 50 00.
   

  

 At Vattenfall we are convinced that diversity contributes to build a more profitable and attractive company and we strive to be good role model regarding diversity. Vattenfall works actively for all employees to have the same opportunities and rights regardless of gender, ethnicity, age, transgender identity or expression, religion or other belief, disability or sexual orientation.
   

  

 We look forward to your application in English with a cover letter, curriculum vitae and relevant certificates or references. Please apply directly via our application link. Please note that we will only start the selection process after the application period has expired.
   

  

 Since Vattenfall is part of the Swedish critical infrastructure many of our positions are security classed. If this position is security classed the final candidates can be subject to a Security Vetting process, according to Swedish legislation.
   

  

**We look forward to your application!**
 Om oss
   

  

 Vattenfall is a European energy company with approximately 20 000 employees. For more than 100 years we have electrified industries, supplied energy to people’s homes and modernized our way of living through innovation and cooperation. We now want to make fossil-free living possible within one generation. To be able to reach this ambitious goal we are looking for talented individuals who, in addition to their passion for their own role, also have strong team spirit and want to contribute to supporting a meaningful corporate mission.

title: HPC System Manager
description:
**Job description** 




 PDC is expanding its group of system administrators. We are looking for two new system managers to become an integral part of our System Operations team currently consisting of eight people, running PDC's computational and storage infrastructure. The work includes administration of the HPC and storage infrastructures and services, development of these services based on user needs and technological advances, and close interaction with the PDC application experts, users and suppliers of computing systems and software.
 



  





 PDC operates state-of-the-art computational and storage resources for a variety of scientific application domains, including mechanics, computational chemistry, life sciences and physics. PDC's current flagship system is an HPE Cray EX system with 1270 nodes and 62 GPU nodes with close to 500 GPUs, making the system the most powerful academic computer in Sweden.
 



  





 For more information about PDC, please see http://www.pdc.kth.se.
 



  





**What we offer** 



* A position at a leading technical university that generates knowledge and skills for a sustainable future.
* Opportunities to attend training and conferences.
* Engaged and ambitious colleagues along with a creative, international and dynamic working environment.
* Work in Stockholm , in close proximity to nature.



 Read more about what it is like to work at KTH
 



  





**Qualifications** 




**Requirements** 



* An academic degree in computer/computing science or in an area that uses HPC calculations or equivalent experience/skills.
* Extensive experience using, deploying, and administrating large Linux-based systems and services, as well as experience operating large HPC systems, preferably in an academic/research environment.
* Excellent knowledge of Linux, standard programming and scripting languages.
* A good command of English. However, it is not necessary to be able to speak Swedish as PDC is an international environment and the work language is English.



  





**Preferred qualifications** 




 Experience of:
 


* Cluster management systems (e.g. HPCM, Xcat).
* Management of physical server infrastructure (e.g. IPMI, Redfish).
* HPC-specific APIs and technologies (e.g. Slurm, MPI, OpenMP, CUDA).
* Virtualisation (e.g. OpenStack, Docker, Singularity).
* Storage systems and technologies (e.g. Lustre, TSM).
* Networking (High speed interconnects, TCP/IP, LAN, WAN).
* Computer hall infrastructure.



 It is very important that you are able to both work well independently and collaborate effectively. Great emphasis will be placed on personal skills.
 



  





**Trade union representatives** 




 Contact information to trade union representatives.
 



  





**To apply for the position** 




 The application must include:
 


* CV including relevant professional experience and knowledge.
* a personal letter describing why the applicant is interested in this position.



  





 Log into KTH's recruitment system in order to apply for this position. You are responsible to ensure that your application is complete according to the instructions in the ad. Your complete application must be received by KTH no later than the last day of application, midnight CET/CEST (Central European Time/Central European Summer Time).
 



  





**About the employment** 




 The employment is valid until further notice (permanent post) according to agreement.
 



 The employment begins with a six-month probationary period.
 



  





**Other information** 




 Striving towards gender equality, diversity and equal conditions is both a question of quality for KTH and a given part of our values.
 



  





 For information about processing of personal data in the recruitment process.
 



 According to The Protective Security Act (2018-585), the candidate must undergo and pass security vetting if the position is placed in a security class. Information regarding whether the position is subject to such a classification will be provided during the recruitment process.
 



  





 We firmly decline all contact with staffing and recruitment agencies and job ad salespersons.
 



 Disclaimer:
 *In case of discrepancy between the Swedish original and the English translation of the job announcement, the Swedish version takes precedence* 




  





**About KTH** 




 KTH Royal Institute of Technology in Stockholm has grown to become one of Europe’s leading technical and engineering universities, as well as a key centre of intellectual talent and innovation. We are Sweden’s largest technical research and learning institution and home to students, researchers and faculty from around the world. Our research and education covers a wide area including natural sciences and all branches of engineering, as well as architecture, industrial management, urban planning, history and philosophy. Read more here

title: Integration Lead to Simployer
description:
We are seeking an experienced and dynamic technical lead to take our integration team to new heights.
   

  

 Simployer/AlexisHR is ramping up our integration capabilities by offering integration solutions to our customers, seamlessly connecting with their existing IT ecosystems, which often include third-party systems such as recruiting software (ATS, CRM, Payroll, and IdP solutions.
   

  

 Our dedicated integration team, supported by a robust platform built on Apache Camel, is at the forefront of these efforts.
   

  

 As the technical lead, you will be responsible for driving our integration capability forward. Your role will involve developing new integration requirements and standardizing existing ones, while promoting a self-service mindset in building integrations.
   

  

**Key responsibilities include:**
* Coordinate and lead the integration team, managing all activities related to the integration of software programs, applications, and third-party solutions to meet both organizational and customer business requirements.
* Develop and maintain a robust integration architecture framework to facilitate scalable and secure connections with external systems.
* Drive the strategy on integration target architecture.
* Build and define an ecosystem of partners and “standard” integrations that connect to our data & onboarding APIs (e.g., pre-integrated HR systems, Payroll systems, Data analysis services, etc.).
* Ensure successful customer adoption to our solutions, connecting them to their other commercial software applications.
* Collaborate with internal stakeholders in product & technology, sales departments, and customer organizations.
* Provide expert advice to product teams on the use of integration technology, data architecture and modeling, system architecture, and best practices.


**Who Are We Looking For?**
* A passionate and experienced professional with a strong technical understanding of concepts such as APIs, Distributed systems, Event sourcing, and integrations. You should have over 5 years of experience as a developer with some level of customer contact or as an Integration Architect.
* Proficiency in building scalable integration services, preferably with systems such as ERP and/or Payroll.
* Fluent in at least one OOP language such as Java, Kotlin, or C#.
* Experience working in cloud environments like AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud.
* Familiarity with Integration Systems such as Apache Camel, Jboss Fuse, WSO2, or Azure Logic Apps.
* Attention to detail and the ability to implement stable and scalable integrations is key to ensuring everything works smoothly.
* Strong analytical abilities and excellent communication skills are critical success factors for this role.


**What would be a plus?**
* Experience in the identity & access management area
* Experience in the HRIS domain (HR master data, HR systems, Payroll data and Employee & Organizational data).


**Our Main Tech Stack:**
**Java** 
 , C#, Kotlin,
 **Spring Boot** 
 ,
 **Apache Camel** 
 ,
 **Docker** 
 ,
 **AWS** 
 , .Net Core, JavaScript, REACT, MS SQL, Rabbit MQ, Event Hub, Azure, Kubernetes, Containers, Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket, Octopus, TeamCity, Azure.

title: Digitalisation Lead to KeyPlants Automation
description:
DO YOU WANT TO BE PART OF BUILDING A NEW BUSINESS AREA WITHIN DIGITALIZATION IN A GLOBAL COMPANY IN THE PHARMACEUTICAL INDUSTRY? APPLY TODAY!
 


 Apply here on other site
 
  

**City :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Job Category :**
 Sales
 



  

**Extent :**
 Full time
 



  

**Start date :**
 ASAP, with regard to notice period
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Recruitment
 



  

**Other :**
 Possibility to work remote
   




**About the role**

 For over 45 years, KeyPlants has consistently delivered predictability, flexibility, and elevated safety standards, exceeding their clients' expectations every time. With Sweden's history of industrial innovation, it comes as no surprise that the off-site manufacturing of pharmaceutical plants began here. KeyPlants were pioneers in bringing the modular facility concept to the life science industry. They have developed their ideas and solutions over the years, in close collaboration with the leading Big Pharma companies. Today, they partner with several of the top 10 pharmaceutical companies, and many regional companies, all around the world.
 


  


 KeyPlants provide solutions such as project definition and front-end engineering, project management services, design and engineering, site instillation etc. During their 15-year history, they have supplied more than 4500 high-specification modules in over 30 countries.
 


  


 In 2018 KeyPlants Automation was founded and today they consist of over 40 engineers and SMEs for multiple automation platforms. Thus, securing the entire scope of automation solution delivery and offering Turn-key System Build and Configuration as well as Project specific services and support. KeyPlants Automation are now looking for a Digitalisation Lead to further expand their business by building and growing a new unit within manufacturing digitalization. This will also include recruiting your own team to be able to expand this new offer towards KeyPlants Automation’s current clients. You will also be responsible for creating and maintaining partnerships, building a strong client base as well as selling digital solutions to customers.
   




**We are looking for**

 We believe that you are great at building and maintaining relationships, both internally with your coworkers as well as externally with suppliers and customers. You reach significant results based on set goals and as a person you are determined, committed and thrives in a fast-paced environment. You have a technical back ground, with a deep understanding of automation solutions, digital integration and proven experience with digital transformation. You also have the ability to collaborate well over different teams and a skill of communicating with both technical- as well as non-technical stakeholders.
 


  


  

**Other requirements for this role are;**



  

  
* +10 years of experience from selling complex solutions towards the manufacturing industry
  
* Proven track record within sales
  
* Fluency in English, written and spoken alike
  
* University degree within relevant area
  


  


  

**It is meritorious if you have;**



  

  
* Experience from Life Science
  
* Good knowledge of GAMP (Good Automated Manufacturing Practice)
  


  

  

**Our recruitment process**
  


 In this process KeyPlants Automation is working together with Winona, if you have any questions please contact Recruitment Responsible: Sandra Isojärvi at sandra.isojarvi@winonagroup.com
 


  


 Our selection process is continuous, and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the screening or interview phase.
 



 When you apply to this application, you will get hired by our partner. This means that you can relax while we take care of the application process.
   




**Do you have questions about this job?**

 Pontus Wiberg or a colleague in the recruitment team will gladly answer you on pontus.wiberg@awexecutivesearch.se Please specify advert-ID in your email: 15103621

title: Enterprise Architect with Domain responsibility
description:
*Do you want to transform a complex IT landscape into a streamlined, efficient machine? Are you excited by the challenge of creating a scalable, future-proof IT architecture? If yes, then you might be the perfect fit for GlobalConnect!*
 At GlobalConnect, we are looking for a Domain Architect who will play a crucial role in our IT transformation journey. You will be responsible for understanding business needs and translating them into effective IT solutions, ensuring our systems are robust, scalable, and aligned with our business goals. This is an opportunity to lead the charge in cleaning up and modernizing our IT environment, working closely with business stakeholders, and implementing strategic initiatives.
   

  

**What will you be doing?**
 In this role, you will start building roadmaps and plans for your designated areas, interfacing with business stakeholders to understand their needs and translating these into IT capabilities. A typical day might include drawing and presenting technical solutions to various teams, supporting ongoing projects, and integrating new M&A data into our systems. Your mission is to streamline our IT operations while maintaining comprehensive service for our customers.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Develop and maintain roadmaps and plans for assigned domains (e.g., marketing, network).
* Support and drive the e2e solutions within IT projects from inception to completion.
* Interface with business stakeholders to understand and translate their needs into IT solutions.
* Create and present technical drawings and plans to architects, enterprise teams, and business units.
* Drive the decommissioning of outdated systems while ensuring ongoing operations are unaffected


**Why Join GlobalConnect?**
 You will be part of a vibrant, pan-Nordic organization with a diverse and enthusiastic culture. Working from our offices in Stockholm or Copenhagen, you’ll collaborate with a diverse team across Norway and Denmark. Your work will directly contribute to making our IT systems lean, scalable, and future-ready, supporting the overall growth of our business.
   

  

**To succeed in this role, you need:**
* Fluency in English.
* Experience in large organizations, particularly in Telecom-utilities or similar sectors.
* At least 5 years of experience in IT, preferably with a background in development and architecture.
* Familiarity with architecture frameworks such as TOGAF or TMF.


 At GlobalConnect, you’ll find a welcoming and engaging environment where your efforts to create a well-oiled IT machine will be valued and recognized. If you are ready to take on the opportunity and drive our IT transformation, we look forward to hearing from you.
   

  

**Apply today and join us in shaping the future of IT at GlobalConnect!**

title: German Speaking Customer Support Agent
description:
**🌍 Let's shape the future of recruitment together! 🌟**
 Teamtailor is an Employer Branding and an ATS SaaS platform used by over 8000 companies, with 200,000+ users in 90 countries worldwide. 🚀
   

  

 Being a part of Teamtailor means joining a dynamic, international tech company where you can make a significant impact on organizational growth. It's a fast-paced environment that encourages responsibility and, of course, having a lot of fun! 🥳
   

  

 Diversity is at the core of Teamtailor. We value team members with varied backgrounds and expertise. There are no standard profiles; everyone shares our vision and strives to contribute to our success.
   

  

**Now, we are expanding our Customer Support Department and seeking a German speaking Customer Support Agent based in Stockholm. 🎉**
 The CS Team on our company trip to Sicily
   

  

 As a member of our Customer Support Team, you will be responsible for our most important communication: that with our existing users. We are renowned for providing exceptional customer service, and we aim to surpass our customers' expectations. Our commitment to quality is reflected in our average response time of 2 minutes and a customer satisfaction rating (CSAT) of 98%.
   

  

 Our goal is to ensure an exceptional experience for every user, resulting in smiles all around. 🤩
   

  

**As a Part Of The Team, You Will**
* Provide outstanding customer service through various support channels, such as live chat (Intercom), email, and occasional outbound phone calls.
* Excel in solving technical problems and troubleshooting, collaborating closely with our skilled tech team to tackle even the most difficult cases.
* Advocate for customer feedback, ensuring it reaches our product development department for continuous improvement.
* Identify, verify, and report bugs to our tech team on behalf of our customers, and then keep them informed about the status of the solution.
* Create informative self-service materials to empower our customers further.
* Take the initiative to engage with customers, nurturing strong relationships and boosting overall satisfaction.


**As The Ideal Candidate**
* You are fluent in both written and spoken German and English, effortlessly communicating with precision and clarity.
* Your customer support journey is extensive, preferably in the SaaS industry.
* An analytical mindset drives you, always seeking insights and embracing continuous learning.
* You have a strong passion for solving technical puzzles, adeptly troubleshooting issues, and feeling comfortable with cutting-edge technology.
* You thrive on delivering exceptional service and possess top-notch tech proficiency.


**Your benefits as a Customer Support Agent at Teamtailor will include:**
* A comfortable work environment with a great work-life balance.
* Continuous skill development training.
* 25 days paid vacation.
* A friendly team and regular social events.
* A starter kit that includes a MacBook, iPhone, and Teamtailor swag!


 Let's team up to build a customer experience that stands out globally. Are you ready to make a real impact? 🌟

title: Quantitative Risk Analyst in IRB models
description:
**Job ID: 25355** 






  

  



 Would you like to use your analytic talent and contribute to a business environment? We are now looking for a Quantitative Risk Analyst to develop new methods within the Internal Rating Based (IRB) space.
   

  

 At Nordea, we’re committed to being a partner our customers and society can count on. Compliance and integrity go hand in hand. Joining us means you’ll have an impact on how we do banking – today and tomorrow. So bring your ideas, skills and unique background. With us, you’ll be in good company with plenty of opportunities to collaborate, grow and make your mark on something bigger.
   

  





**About this opportunity**




 Welcome to the Risk Models Methodology & IRB Models team. We add value by analysing data and turning it into predictive risk models. At Nordea, we use internal models for calculating regulatory capital and these models are developed and maintained by Risk Models. As the Quantitative Risk Analyst, you’ll play a valuable role in making the data come together into new and structured insights.
   

  



**What you’ll be doing:**



* Extracting and transforming data into valuable insights
* Finding and remedying data issues by proposing a way to address them
* Develop and align new methodology and code across IRB models
* Presenting your work to internal stakeholders
* Driving projects across different credit risk workstreams
* Growing into a subject matter expert



  

  



 You’ll join a team with variety of backgrounds and skills in Finland, Denmark, Poland and Sweden.
   

  





**Who you are**




 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.  
   

  

**To succeed in this role, we believe that you:** 





* Have an analytical and problem-solving mindset


* Enjoy working in a team, but also master working independently.


* Work well in a dynamic and constantly changing work environment with varying workload


* Have strong analytical skills and keen attention to detail with the ability to analyse complex data and processes to derive meaningful insights
 





 , yet able to see the big picture.
* Have good communication and presentations skills, you are not afraid to speak up and can effectively translate complex topics to a variety of stakeholders


* Are curious and proactive, focus on solutions rather than problems and share our enthusiasm for developing and learning and constantly improving your skills and competences



  

  

**Your experience and background:**



* Academic degree – either at Master or PhD level – in
 





 Finance, Mathematics, Engineering or Physics


* Hands on experience with data or demonstratable computing skills (data extraction and manipulation, visualisation)
* Understanding of the credit risk/IRB area, particularly working previously with credit risk would be an advantage but is not a prerequisite


* A certain coding/scripting proficiency is expected – Python/SQL/Pyspark/Hadoop skills would be seen as an advantage
* Interest in business/economy/finance/investing
* Written and spoken proficiency in English



  
 





 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
 





  
 





**Next steps**




 Submit your application no later than
 





 31/07/2024
 





 .
   

  

 At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.
 





  
 





 Please be aware that a
 
 ny applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.
 






  
 





 Only for candidates in Finland: A security clearance will be performed for the person selected for this position.
 





  
 





 Only for candidates in Sweden: For union information, please contact finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACONordea@nordea.com.
 





  
 



  
 





 Only for candidates in Poland:
 







 Please include permit for processing personal data in CV as following:
 







  
 







 In accordance with art. 6 (1) a and b. Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (General Data Protection Regulation) hereinafter ‘GDPR’. I agree to have: my personal data, education and employment history proceeded for the purposes of current and future recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp.
 







  
 







 The administrator of your personal data is: Nordea Bank Abp operating in Poland through its Branch, address: Aleja Edwarda Rydza Śmiglego 20, 93-281 Łodź. Your personal data will be processed for the recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp. You have a right to access your personal data, right to rectify and right to delete. Disclosing the personal data in the scope specified by the provisions of Polish Labour Code from 26 June 1974 and executive acts are mandatory. Providing personal data is necessary to conduct the recruitment processes. The request for the deletion of your personal data means resignation from further participation in recruitment processes and causes the immediate removal of your application. Detailed information concerning processing of your personal data can be found at:  
 







 https://www.nordea.com/en/doc/nordea-privacy-policy-for-applicants.pdf
 







  
 







 We reserve the right to reply only to selected applications.

title: M&A Advisory and Strategy
description:
**M&A Advisory and Strategy** 




 Do you wish to take on a influencial and propelling role within Netlights M&A Advisory and strategy team? Do you have experience from and are passionate about M&A, Due Diligence, Advisory and Strategy? Do you want to leverage your insights and perspectives and take a pivotal role in shaping, driving and growing Netlights M&A Advisory offering? In addition, are you interested in tech and would like a career spanning both strategy development as well as operational implementation within the forefront of digitalization?
 



  





 Then you could be the one developing, expanding and taking Netlights M&A Advisory offering to the next level together with us!
 



  





 M&A Advisory and Strategy has been growing significantly at Netlight during the last 5+ years, developing to a highly prioritized service area and actively expanding in a global market working with both local growth funds and global large-scale funds. To continue the growth with continued high pace, we will now benefit from experience and perspectives from the commercial side within the whole M&A Advisory and strategy offering to continue our path to the next level.
 



  





**Come work with us** 




 Netlight as a company strives to be a truly diverse, equitable and inclusive organization. Regardless of who you are, what personality, background, and experience you have, you enrich our culture through your values. Netlight’s purpose is to unleash full potential, realize great careers, and fulfill personal growth. To achieve this, we have a highly engaged network organization, where every employee gets a mentor, delivery coach and personal communities. The key to our continued success is trust and personal responsibility, diverse experiences, challenging opportunities and developing from personal values. Every Netlighter is an active part of building and shaping this culture, which leads to a clear correlation between personal growth and the growth of Netlight.
 



  





**About us** 




 Netlight provides a full range of premium IT-consulting services at the forefront of the digital industry and stands out for its product- and technology-independent expertise in a wide range of industries and clients. We are a network organization of more than 2 000 role models making aspiring digital leaders successful in their business-critical IT projects. Netlight has been awarded several times as top employer, as well as for growth, continued profitability and engagement for diversity, equity and equality within the IT industry. Today we are growing all across Europe, currently with more than 10 active international offices.
 



  





**This role enables you to** 




 - Take a pivotal role in building, shaping and grow Netlights strategy offering both internally and externally by being actively involved in the strategic positioning of the team and Netlight as a whole.
 



 - Leverage your commercial experience within M&A and Strategy and apply it into a high intense IT context to be the catalyst for commercial value creation.
 



 - Being a key contributor in the M&A Advisory & Strategy team with high seniority and partner involvement with a direct exposure to the client and target stakeholders creating real impact.
 



 - Being part of the entire project lifecycle, from active project engagement to sales, stakeholder management and strategy planning.
 



 - Engage yourself to drive and be the bridge to Netlights other service areas to grow and create a collaborative environment.
 



 - Use the role as a platform to not only evolve your advisory, strategy and leadership skills, but also to build competence and experience to take on interim roles, drive transformation projects, and working with state-of-the-art technologies at Industry leading tech companies.
 



 - Develop your leadership management skills through coaching and mentoring internally.
 



  





**Minimum Qualifications** 




 - Master Degree in Engineering, Technology or equivalent.
 



 - 2-5 years of experience within M&A, Due Diligence and/or Strategy either from Consulting or operational position.
 



 - Verbal and written fluency in English is required.
 



 - International mindset, as you will collaborate with Netlighters and clients across offices.
 



  





*Application: We will get in touch within two weeks if we find that your profile and experiences are a match beyond the qualifications at this time.*

title: CRM Campaign Optimisation Specialist
description:
TUI is transforming our marketing to be highly relevant to each customer, driven by their history and behaviours. Join us as we move to advanced, highly personalised customer journeys, campaigns and activities automated by real-time data and analytics. As a CRM Campaign Optimisation Specialist, you’ll deliver analytically driven campaign insights for our 1 to 1 automated campaigns and journeys. You’ll use customer and campaign data to generate insights and spot opportunities to increase engagement, drive sales and enhance consumer experience.
   

  

 You will be responsible for setting up a testing framework and to drive the optimisation of our industry-leading CRM campaigns and journeys that leverage the power of the leading real-time marketing platform - Braze. You will optimise automated journeys and campaigns (templates & components) for all markets using all available channels (e.g. mobile push, in-app messages and content cards, email etc.).
   

  

 At TUI we believe that work is something you do not somewhere you go, therefore we are pleased to advise we can consider a hybrid working model for this role. Closing date for applications will be Wednesday 17th July
   

  

 This role can be based in either our Luton, Hannover, Rijswijk, Zanentem or Stockholm office.
   

  

**About The Job**
 Campaign and Segment Analytics:
   

  

* Create action-driven insights from campaign tests and performance metrics.
* Use analytical techniques to generate data insights and translate these into business stories to drive action.
* Understand campaign metrics, channel mix, audience optimization, and testing techniques.
* You will work closely with the Group Analytics team to ensure knowledge transfer and align on methodologies.


 Journey & Campaign Optimisation:
   

  

* Build testing frameworks for CRM campaign optimisation and AB tests.
* Build advanced CRM campaign or journey optimisations and tests.
* Ensure audience size for marketing automations is optimised.
* Work with Platform & Analytics teams to define data requirements for delivery and evaluation of each campaign test.
* Become an expert in Braze on CRM campaign testing and optimisations.


**About You**
* Proven experience in similar analytical and or campaign optimisation roles
* Good technical knowledge of marketing platforms, and good knowledge of relevant coding languages (SQL, Python, R, Liquid script etc.)
* Preferably a proven track record of implementing multichannel marketing communications through industry-leading technology (ideally Braze but also Salesforce, Adobe, EMarsys, IBM etc.)
* Comfortable working in a large pan European business, where some travel will be required.
* Fluent in English, ability in other languages desirable but not essential (German, French & Dutch)
* Strong problem solving capabilities, organisation skills and very logical train of thought
* Capability to communicate between IT and Marketing
* Excellent attention to detail
* Education in quantitative field (business economics, data analysis, statistics)


**About Our Offer**
* Fantastic holiday benefits including discounts, special offers and the ability to purchase additional ‘TUI time off’
* Health and Wellbeing support in five key areas – Financial, Health, Social, Community and Career
* Discretionary Bonus Scheme
* Private Medical Insurance, single cover with option to add dependants
* Permanent Health Insurance
* Excellent rates with foreign exchange
* Pension scheme and life assurance


 We want to be the best-loved holiday company not only for our customers, but for our colleagues too. That’s why we offer a variety of benefits that go above and beyond a competitive salary, so we can help you to live your best life happily at TUI. Click here to find out more.
   

  

 We love to see your uniqueness shine through and inspire the future of travel. If you would like to read more about what Diversity & Inclusion means to us simply visit Our DNA
   

  

 If you require any further information regarding this opportunity, please email careers@tui.co.uk. We really value your interest in TUI and will be back in touch with you shortly after the application closing date.

title: Account Executive - AboardHR
description:
**We're establishing a new HR-tech product, and we're looking for those with a hunter mentality to join us. Sounds interesting, doesn't it? Let's talk!** 




  





 Teamtailor is a leading company in HR Tech with a groundbreaking SaaS solution that helps businesses streamline and improve their recruitment and employer brand with over 9500 customers and in +90 countries 🌎. We strive to create a work environment where innovation, collaboration, and personal development are at the core.
 



  





 Building on our success with our candidate-oriented platform, we're now also focusing on the employee journey. We're excited to introduce AboardHR, our new HR system designed to enhance the employee experience 🧨.
 



  





 To achieve this vision, we are seeking dynamic sales executives with HR or SaaS experience.
 



 Interested in making a mark in a new market and passionate about innovation? We'd like to hear from you. We are looking for those with the hunter mentality it takes to establish a new product in the market to join a startup team backed by a successful scaleup company. Let's shape the future of employee engagement together!🚀🚀
 



  





**📌 Responsibilities:** 



* Identify and prospect new business opportunities within the target market.
* In this role, you are responsible for booking all your meetings yourself. You need to maintain a high level of activity over the phone, email, and LinkedIn.
* Build and maintain strong customer relationships by understanding the customer's needs and offering tailored solutions.
* Conduct product demonstrations and presentations for potential customers.
* Negotiate and finalize sales agreements.
* Work closely with marketing and product teams to ensure customer feedback is integrated into our product development.
* Achieve and exceed sales targets and KPIs.



  





**💡Qualifications:** 



* At least 2 years of sales experience in the SaaS or technology sector.
* Strong communication skills and experience with giving presentations.
* Ability to work independently and in a team.
* Driven, goal-oriented, and with a positive attitude.
* Experience in HR Tech is a plus but not required.



  





*You'll be working full-time at our Stockholm office📍 . For us, personality and passion are the most important things. Joining Teamtailor means being part of a fun and ambitious team. We look forward to hearing from you!* 
 👋

title: Global Digital Lead Counsel - Motion Business Area
description:
At ABB, we are dedicated to addressing global challenges. Our core values: care, courage, curiosity, and collaboration - combined with a focus on diversity, inclusion, and equal opportunities - are key drivers in our aim to empower everyone to create sustainable solutions.
   

  

 That's our story. Make it your story.
   

  

 This position reports to
   

  

 Chief Counsel
   

  

 Your role and responsibilities
   

  

 As Digital Lead Counsel you act as the subject matter expert on Digital, Software, AI, Cyber security and Contract Lifecycle Management (“Digital”) legal matters and provide legal support to the ABB Motion Business Area across all Divisions/Markets, focusing on the Digital legal needs of the business. As a strategic business partner and enabler, you strongly collaborate with our Division Lead Counsel and Regional General Counsels.
   

  

 This role reports to the Global General Counsel Motion.
   

  

 Candidates in one of the following location will be preferred: Finland, Sweden, Italy, Spain or India.
   

  

 Key Responsibilities:
   

  

* Help develop and support the strategy of Motion Business Area and Divisions on Digital initiatives and programs.
* Provide day-to-day legal advice, guidance and support to the BA, the divisions and countries on worldwide digital activities & projects in areas of emerging technologies, data management, cyber security, and software.
* Provide legal advice on strategic alliances, commercial and marketing initiatives and programs, product development and certification and all commercialization opportunities.
* In collaboration with the Corporate Center of Expertise for Digital and with other BA legal teams, lead the development of contract standards, templates and guidelines and ensures their deployment, implementation, and operationalization within Motion.
* Acting as the legal point of contact (SPOC) for implementation projects on the Motion Business Area level in relation to new legislation.
* Develop training curriculum and provide training and guidance to the Motion business within the area of expertise.
* Drive improvement and development of contractual model clauses on Digital Risks and obligations.
* Review, draft and assist in negotiations of customer contracts and deals in the focus areas. (Common and BA & division distinct).
* Keep abreast of legal developments, in particular commercial, regulatory and integrity risks that arise in respect of Digital laws and regulations, with responsibility to ensure legal team and business stakeholders are informed and updated on legal developments.
* Focal point of contact for legal and integrity support for all Motion Cyber Security and Data breach incidences.
* Providing legal support for Business Area and division specific cyber security matters and incident response (in accordance with corporate policies and procedures).
* Providing legal expertise for technology M&A transactions within the Business Area and divisions.
* Sets, develops, & leads strategy, objectives, and targets in alignment with Motion strategy. Influences & consults with senior management in the Divisions/BA to innovatively ensure effectiveness of own functional area.
* Proactively collaborates with the division teams. Maintains an external awareness and perspective and acts as the acknowledged expert, with consulting responsibility on functional area knowledge and trends. Facilitates the sharing of best practices and ensures harmonized and standardized processes throughout the Business Area to deliver consistent support.
* Fully understands the ABB Way of operating and operates IS in close alignments with the divisions across the Motion Business Area.
* Ensures that the area of responsibility is organized, staffed, skilled and directed. Guides, motivates, and develops direct/indirect subordinates within HR policies, for the benefit of both ABB and the employee. Effects people decisions in the function’s scope of activities in cooperation with the Business Area function.
* Ensures all employees in the function understand corporate governance, safety and integrity standards and act accordingly. Acts as a personal role model for the organization in this regard. Contributes to effective risk management by providing advice to Executive Committee and senior management on key ABB Group policy decisions.


**Qualifications For The Role**
* Bachelor’s or Master's degree in the legal field, being a qualified attorney will be a plus
* 10+ years of professional experience, ideally gained in a global, cross-cultural and cross-functional environment as in-house lawyer or in a reputable law firm with a focus on software, digital legal tools, legal technology process development.
* Outstanding negotiation and stakeholder management skills driven by collaboration, transparency and technical knowhow and ability to work in complex international environment, substantial experience.
* Demonstrable leadership experience, leading and motivating (face to face and remotely) functional, business and cross-functional and cross-country teams.
* Superior advocacy and communication skills, including the ability to communicate in writing effectively and efficiently and orally, an aptitude for practical negotiation, the capability to think clearly and quickly under pressure, the composure to satisfy multiple and often competing interests and ability to share lessons learned with teammates.
* Strong drafting and negotiation skills on a global level and ability to work in a complex international environment.
* Interest and curiosity in technical topics, including the rapid development of digital technologies such as artificial intelligence, CLM and software contracts, and in acquiring a deep understanding in Digital Business Models.
* Fluency in English with strong communication, presentation, and networking skills.
* Ability to work autonomously and independently.
* The highest integrity and professionalism, and passion for excellence and quality.
* Working in different cultures and an open mind which champions diversity and inclusion.
* The working model for this role is hybrid.


 More about us
   

  

 ABB Motion keeps the world turning, while saving energy every day. Our pioneering drives, motors, generators, traction converters and mechanical power transmission products are driving the low-carbon future for industries, cities, infrastructure and transportation. Through our global presence we are always close to our customers. We help them optimize energy efficiency, improve safety and reliability and achieve precise control of their applications.
   

  

 We value people from different backgrounds. Could this be your story? Apply today or visit www.abb.com to read more about us and learn about the impact of our solutions across the globe. #MyABBStory
   

  

  

**92165480**

title: Managing Director, Trilogy (Remote) - $400,000/year USD
description:
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Have you got what it takes?
   

  

 If you think most CEOs are full of themselves (and full of other stuff)... keep reading.
   

  

 Here’s a CEO track that requires — and actually rewards — zero experience being a CEO. In this role, you’ll become an incredibly effective, customer-facing CEO in an environment with more than 100 software products.
   

  

 Who You Are
   

  

 You’ve never been a CEO before. Probably because most of the time, “CEO” is just a 3-letter code for “an exhausting hamster wheel of team building and internal operations logistics.” And hopping on that hamster wheel would be a huge waste of your talent and potential.
   

  

 You’re smart. You keep things clear and direct. And while you’ve worked in SaaS for many years, you don’t have a decade of outdated “leadership” learnings to unlearn. You’re ready to be the leader that smart employees like you have been waiting for. This job right here is your launchpad.
   

  

 You're a generative AI power user. You've used ChatGPT, Claude, Bard, or a similar tool to automate previously manual workflows (note: this role does not require a software development background).
   

  

 You should already be well on your way to building a strong personal brand. We believe in the importance of a personal brand, and we’ll help you develop yours. You should understand the benefits and impact of a personal brand, the long-tail nature of content, and the effort it takes.
   

  

 You have experience with quickly moving products, particularly in leadership roles during the launch of epic new features. If you’ve been part of teams going from Seed through Series A/B rounds, that’s a huge plus. You’ve got proven ability to get customers excited about new product features and have used metrics like net dollar retention and win-back rates (and others) to measure the impact of new product features.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Implementing AI-driven Productivity Improvements: Utilizing generative AI tools to streamline and automate various workflows across the company.
* Customer Engagement and Feedback: Interacting with customers to gather insights and feedback, and using this information to enhance product offerings.
* Develop a Personal Monopoly: Publishing podcast episodes and blog posts and building a social media following to evangelize your portfolio's AI-driven products.


**What You Won’t Be Doing**
* Busywork that drains your creativity.
* Day-in, day-out team management or internal operations that distract from your vision.
* Tinker with the business model to figure out what works. (Remember, we’re giving you the playbook.)


**Basic Requirements**
**Managing Director key responsibilities**
* At least 8 years of work experience in the enterprise software industry
* Leadership experience in marketing, sales, business development, partnerships, professional services, or another hands-on customer-facing domain
