title: Senior Accountant
description:
Redeploy is a rapidly growing consultant company specializing in cloud. We are set to significantly impact the cloud business over the coming years and are on a mission to build something truly extraordinary.


At Redeploy, we believe in taking care of each other and fostering an environment where everyone can thrive. Show initiative, and you'll find plenty of opportunities to grow and develop within our team. Our work culture emphasizes continuous learning and dynamic career development.


We cherish the time spent together at our various offices but also recognize the importance of work-life balance. This flexibility allows you to balance work with personal errands, fitness, or other activities that you enjoy. Take inspiration from our colleague Sebastian, our cloud consultant who skillfully manages his professional responsibilities while pursuing his passion for beekeeping.

 **THE ROLE**


Redeploy is now growing with a Senior Accountant, a fun and broad role in a growth company that suits those who appreciate variety and can prioritize smartly. Your close collaboration with the CFO will make the role vital in impacting how we work in the Finance team. We collaborate with PE Accounting, meaning you'll oversee processes such as monthly closings, taxes, bookkeeping, and payroll, ensuring seamless communication and efficient routines. The responsibilities will also include customer invoicing, and working closely with project managers and sales.


In addition to monthly closing activities, you'll assist with cost center allocation, follow up on bank transactions, cost control and compile financial reports for monthly reporting.


**POSSIBILITIES**

* Be a substantial part of taking Redeploy's Finance team to the next level.
* Be essential in supporting the continued growth and expansion.
* Holistic view with stakeholders across the different business areas.
* Serve as the primary contact for employees and assist in employee onboarding and offboarding.

**WE BELIEVE YOU HAVE**

* Academic education in economics.
* Experience in handling monthly accounts, taxes & fees, current accounting, payroll, customer invoicing, bookkeeping etc.
* Experience from a consulting company or experience from an accounting firm where you have had overall responsibility for consulting companies.
* Ability to prioritize based on what is most important from an overall perspective.

**It is a bonus if you have**

* Experience of working with PE Accounting.

**How to Apply**

If you're ready to launch your career and make a meaningful impact at Redeploy through your passion for Accounting, then don’t hesitate to send in your application by hitting the apply button. We look forward to hearing from you! ️

title: Microsoft Security Specialist
description:
**Job Role / Responsibilities**

  

The Technical consultant will work closely with the professional services and MDR teams to deliver growth and commercial success through working with and assisting in the Development of Integrity360’s Cybersecurity Services portfolio, and Managed Detection and Response in particular. We have a large portfolio of Endpoint protection vendors that we deliver Professional Services and training courses on. This individual will have a great understanding of cybersecurity needs and related solutions and managed services across its many domains and knows what excellence looks like to deliver on Enterprise customer expectations. In the past months we have built a very successful Microsoft Services Department that needs to be expanded due to customer demand specialising in Defender ATP and the M365 security stack. We have great demand from our customers to deploy Defender ATP and assistance in getting the most out of their M365\E5 product entitlement.

 **Key Responsibilities**

  

* Technical market research in the field of managed cyber security services, platforms, and solutions
* Assisting sales in winning deals, architecting deployments, and performing the technical delivery and training on the solutions.
* Technical input into business case development to justify proposed investments in managed services.
* Work with subject-matter experts in the business to build great services.
* Perform on site or remote assessments, consultancy and HLD and LLD design services featuring the M365 security stack, and more.

  


**Candidate requirements**

  

* Advanced Windows Server and Desktop operational and troubleshooting knowledge.
* Excellent understanding of Active Directory and Group Policy architecture
* Good knowledge of VMWare\HyperV, Azure
* Experience supporting and administration of Microsoft SQL, Microsoft Exchange, Exchange Online, Intune, Defender ATP and SCCM. M365 security stack consulting experience (Defender ATP all the way to Identity and Cloud is a must)
* Experience with Windows 7-11. Experience with Linux is a plus.
* Good understanding of TCP/IP networking.
* Ability to communicate technical information to nontechnical personnel.
* Ability to manage client expectation.
* Ability to prioritise your own time.
* A real passion for technology.
* Excellent documentation skills.
* A sense of good customer service
* A strong team player
* Practical deployment, architecture, and consultative experience in scoping, installing, auditing, configuring, and training on the technical solutions mentioned in this document.
* Understanding of CASB, SSE, ZTNA, ATP, EDR, NDR, XDR, SOC, SIEM, SOAR, CNAP, DLP, NGAV, Web and Email security software, Vulnerability management, Mitre ATT&CK Framework Fundamentals, NIST / ISO/IEC 270001 Frameworks, HIPAA Governance Frameworks, GDPR Policy Frameworks, LM (Lockheed Martin) Cyber Kill Chain

  


**What you will bring to us:**

  

* Should have a minimum of 4 years’ experience in professional services. managed security services, preferably in a next generation SOC environment or in an MSSP or MDR provider.
* 3 Years Experience with Endpoint Security Implementation / Management
* 2-3 Years Experience in Customer Service Environments
* Skills and experience in detection and response operations and services is a major plus.
* Good understanding of the security vendor and vendor category landscape
* Relevant Cyber Security certifications
* Initiative and focus on continuous improvement.
* Must be systems and process oriented, and a self-motivated learner.
* Experience with administering enterprise servers and other systems.
* Proficiency in all aspects of system administration and engineering of Microsoft technologies to deploy and maintain global infrastructure services in our enterprise with an emphasis on the platforms mentioned.

  


**Qualifications**

  

* Must be educated to degree level or similar
* CompTIA A+
* CompTIA N+
* CompTIA Security+
* Microsoft – MS-500
* Microsoft – AZ-500
* Microsoft Configuration Manager (SCCM) Management / Configuration
* Microsoft Intune / Endpoint Manager Management / Configuration
* Microsoft Active Directory Domain Administration
* Microsoft Azure Active Directory Management
* Microsoft Data Loss Protection Management / Configuration
* Microsoft PIM (Identity and Access Management Management) Management / Configuration
* Microsoft Security Centre Management / Configuration
* Microsoft Cloud App Security

  


**Additional Knowledge (will contribute to your application):**


* Trend, Trellix\Mcafee\Skyhigh, Carbon black, Varonis, CrowdStrike, Mimecast, Rapid 7, Qualys, Splunk, Vectra, CyberArk, Microsoft Sentinel, AZ-800, AZ-801, SC-100, SC-200, SC-400

title: HR Business Partner
description:
**About Us**

**nShift** is the leading global provider of cloud delivery management solutions (SaaS), we enable the frictionless shipment and return of almost one billion shipments across 190 countries each year. We are headquartered in London and Oslo and have over 500 employees across offices in Sweden, Finland, Norway, Denmark, the United Kingdom, Poland, the Netherlands, Belgium, and Romania.


Our software is used by many of the world leading e-commerce, retail, manufacturing, and 3PL shippers due to us having over 1000 carriers integrated into our platform, nearly 3 times more than our competitors!

  

If you buy goods online, there is a strong chance that nShift has powered that delivery, so come and join us as we shape the future of shipping, one frictionless journey at a time.

**Purpose of role**


We are looking to recruit an HR Business Partner to help build our People department and support the integration and merger of our brands across 10 geographies.


Reporting to the Global HR Director and working closely with the People Team you will provide a full range of generalist HR skills & HRBP services to the business, working with teams at all levels in the organization.

**Overall responsibility**

* Proactively work with and support the People Team and department activities
* Facilitate and manage HR initiatives, support organizational change, and enhance employee engagement and productivity.
* Provide guidance and input on business unit restructures and workforce planning.
* Support cross-functional engagement.
* Drive performance by supporting the development of a talent strategy and identifying training needs for teams and individuals.
* Evolve onboarding activities to provide a truly engaging and relevant induction experience.
* Serve as a point of contact for employee inquiries and concerns, providing guidance and resolving issues in a timely and effective manner.
* Promote a positive work environment and culture through employee engagement initiatives and activities.
* Embed diversity and inclusion initiatives.
* Develop and roll out manager and employee workshops.
* Facilitate performance management processes, including goal setting, performance reviews, and development plans.
* Identify training needs and partner with the People team to deliver appropriate training programs.
* And more

**About you**

* Be adaptable and pragmatic in your approach to business opportunities
* Comfortable with change and evolution – we are building a global brand
* Be part of the front-line HR team representing the business and our people initiatives
* Be solutions-focused and creative with your approach – This is going to be fun!
* Have excellent people management skills – you’re building out a dynamic people function
* Have experience working with HR metrics to make business decisions and drive performance
* Demonstrate a full understanding of all HR functions and best practice
* Be used to working in matrix management environments

**The area of responsibility includes:**


* Collaborate with the Global HR Director to develop nShift's employee experience strategy.
* Act as a proactive business partner to support and advise stakeholders.
* Coach, support, and challenge management to enhance the employee experience.
* Provide daily HR guidance and consultation to managers to help them achieve optimal performance.
* Work collaboratively with the wider People Team function across all countries.
* Lead ongoing change management projects to improve team performance.
* Resolve employee relations issues and address grievances effectively.
* Supervise payroll team members to address business-related concerns, advise on taxes and employment laws related to salaries.
* Support the People Operations team.
* Assist in developing learning strategies and identifying training needs for teams and individuals.
* Address complex employee relations issues and grievances.
* Work closely with management and employees to improve work relationships, build morale, and increase productivity and retention.
* Provide guidance on People Team policies.

**Requirements**

* Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field
* 5+ years of experience as an HR Business Partner or in a similar strategic HR Generalist level role
* Fluency in Swedish and English (written and spoken)
* Proven ability to build effective relationships with leadership and influence decision-making
* Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.
* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to build relationships at all levels of the organization.
* Comfortable navigating a fast-changing environment and managing change
* Proficiency in HR systems

**Desirable but not essential:**

* Understanding of Nordic/Swedish labour laws and employment practice
* Led training and career pathing initiatives

title: Machine Learning Engineer 6 Months Contract
description:
For our client we are looking for a
 **Machine Learning Engineer** 
 .
   

  

**The primary tasks for a Machine Learning Engineer in MLE area are:**
* Develop AI/ML software products including but not limited to explore large data set, try out new algorithms, feature engineering, test and evaluate model output, deploy the solution for production usage and scale out for a maintainable solution in the comprehensive fashion network of H&M
* Design, develop and maintain the large-scale data infrastructure required for the AI/ML projects
* Leverage on understanding of software architecture and software design patterns to write scalable, maintainable, well-designed, and future-proof code
* Develop solutions, components, services and frameworks to address both specific and common needs in AI/ML projects, like feature reuse, model traceability, monitoring, A/B test, versioning, release, and serving of both online inference end-points and batch inference
* Work in cross-functional agile team of highly skilled engineers, data scientists, business stakeholders to build the AI ecosystem within the company


**Required skills and experiences:**
* Have a BSc or MSc degree in computer science, engineering or related field, or equivalent practical experience
* Have 4+ years' professional experience working in relevant role(s) for a Machine Learning Engineer
* A hands-on person, with great software engineering skills, who loves coding, and like applying software engineering practices to machine learning and AI projects
* Have experience in developing software products that have been successfully deployed to production and scaled in a bigger organization
* Have several years of coding experience in modern programming languages, and strong background in Python programming, i.e. 4+ years
* Have great hands-on experience with cloud technologies for ML development, preferably Google Cloud Platform, and also including Vertex AI
* Have solid experience in MLOps practices, developing ML pipelines, data pipelines and deploying ML applications to production
* Have a strong working knowledge of a variety of AI/ML techniques and experience working with different frameworks
* Have experience handling and developing for high volume heterogeneous data (both batch and stream), preferably also including hands-on development in DBT, and have also a solid understanding of cloud data storage technologies and data quality
* Have experience from aligning and analyzing requirement; driving design solutions; breaking down work into stories and tasks; and making sure organizational standards and best-practices are implemented and followed
* Familiar with agile ways of working, team collaboration, data-driven development, reliable and responsible experimentation

title: Director of Alliance Management
description:
**Company Description**
***Statistics show that women and underrepresented groups tend to apply to jobs only if they meet 100% of the qualifications. Sobi encourages you to change that statistic and apply. Rarely do candidates meet 100% of the qualifications. We look forward to your application!***
 At Sobi, each person brings their unique talents to work as a team and make a difference. We are dedicated to developing and delivering innovative therapies to improve the lives of people who live with a rare disease. Our edge comes from our team of people and our commitment to patients.
   

  

 Here At Sobi, Our Mission And Culture Get Us Excited To Come To Work Every Day, But Here Are a Few More Reasons To Join Our Team
   

  

* Competitive compensation for your work
* Emphasis on work/life balance
* Collaborative and team-oriented environment
* Opportunities for professional growth
* Diversity and Inclusion
* Making a positive impact to help ultra-rare disease patients who are in need of life saving treatments


**Job Description**
 The Alliance Management group’s purpose is to maximize the value of Sobi’s investments in Alliances, ensuring delivery of what is contractually defined as well as the spirit and intent of the Alliance, implement a fit for purpose governance model, be a
 **thought partner** 
 for the key stakeholders and foster
 **a collaborative relationship** 
 between Sobi and our Partners.
   

  

 The scope includes
 **drug development and commercialization at all stages** 
 of the product life cycle. This includes strategic in- and out- licenses, collaborations, commercialization partnerships and acquisitions. This role will be a key contributor in developing and maintaining strategic alliances at Sobi.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Oversee the governance of multiple strategic Alliances in development and commercialization partnerships, this including managing governance committees, identifying key issues and providing vetted solutions to key decision makers
* Monitor implementation of and adherence to agreed-upon research, development and commercialization plans; take appropriate action to ensure execution
* Lead the strategic focus to develop a global alliance roadmap/toolkit to ensure alliance management is well defined in all stages of business development (from due diligence to contract development and then implementation)
* Compliance/contract management – liaise with legal, finance, R&D, Commercial and other functions to ensure that key contract milestones, financial transactions, progress reports, etc. are handled appropriately and provide information/updates as needed
* Work directly with the partner company to set the direction and scope for implementation of partnership agreement: key activities, timing and responsibilities on either side
* Crisis management- address hot topic issues that require immediate attention while working to minimize crisis management situations
* Conduct regular reviews/meetings with senior management and other functions as appropriate to communicate key issues, milestones, etc. and gather feedback


**Qualifications**
* Strong business acumen, enterprise thinking, leadership and self-direction with a high learning agility
* Demonstrated Emotional Intelligence with excellent interpersonal skills with ability to lead, interact with, focus, negotiate, resolve conflict
* Demonstrated ability to understand and navigate contract language
* Demonstrated ability to identify, prioritize and resolve key project and partnership issues
* Demonstrated attention to detail and excellence in project management and effectively managing multiple projects/priorities
* Demonstrated ability to work with and coordinate demands from multiple customers, both internally and with partners
* Must be able to handle ambiguity well


**Reporting to**
 VP of Business Development and Alliance Management
   

  

**Additional Information**
 All Sobi employees need to demonstrate behaviors in line with Sobi's core values: Care, Ambition, Urgency, Ownership and Partnership. Are you ready to be on the Sobi team? Come join a culture that empowers every person to be the person that makes a difference for rare disease.
   

  

**Why Join Us?**
 We are a global company with over 1,700 employees in more than 30 countries and are committed to the societies where we operate. With a deeply skilled management team directing our day-to-day wins, and a Board with a stellar track record, we’re ready to take on the world’s diseases, ailments and adversity. Our people believe they have the power to make a positive impact in others’ lives because that’s exactly what we do here. If you’re seeking a career that taps into your talents in a way that makes the world a better, healthier place, we just may have a job for you.
   

  

 We know our employees are our most valuable asset, and our culture conveys that. We offer a competitive benefits package, to support the health and happiness of our staff.
   

  

**Sobi Culture**
 At Sobi, we refuse to accept the status quo. This is because we have witnessed first-hand the challenges facing those affected by rare diseases, and have used this knowledge to shape our business to find new ways of helping them.
   

  

 As a specialized biopharmaceutical company, we are dedicated to rare diseases. And we see this focus as a strength. By effectively turning our research into ground-breaking treatments, we help make medicine more accessible and open up more possibilities for patients and more opportunities for those caring for them. This has been our approach since day one, but we know we can’t change the world of rare diseases on our own. Accomplishing this requires strong partnerships with patients, partners and stakeholders across the entire value chain. Together, we define how our business can create solutions that serve the needs of those affected by rare diseases while facilitating sustainable growth.
   

  

**An Equal Opportunity Employer**
 Sobi is an Equal Opportunity Employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. All employment decisions at Sobi are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veterans and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status or protected groups by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.
   

  

*Sobi is an affirmative action and equal opportunity employer. Disabled/Veterans. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access this website to apply for a vacancy as a result of your disability. You can request reasonable accommodations by sending an email to irina.conc@sobi.com*
**COVID-19 Policy**
 For the safety of our employees and all individuals with whom we interact professionally, Sobi North America requires all new hires in the U.S. to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 with proof of vaccination status. We will consider requests for reasonable medical or religious accommodations, as well as any state-specific exemptions, as required by applicable law.

title: Konsultchef till Enterprise Applications
description:
***Vi på Nexer Enterprise Applications är konsulter med bred specialistkunskap och erfarenhet inom Microsoft Dynamics 365. Vill du arbeta på ett globalt företag i framkant som lägger stor vikt vid individens utveckling och där du kan vara med och påverka vår resa framåt? Just nu söker vi en relationsbyggande konsultchef med erfarenhet av Supply Chain till ett av våra Dynamics-team!***
***Är det du? Vänta inte med att söka!***
 Våra team växer och vi söker nu en ytterligare konsultchef som kan leda och stödja våra konsulter samt ansvara för rekrytering av nya härliga kollegor. Hos oss är det viktigt att trivas på jobbet. Vi letar efter dig som vill bli en del av vårt team och bidra till att vi fortsätter vara det självklara valet för Sveriges bästa IT-konsulter inom Dynamics!
   

  

 Som en del av ett växande företag och en företagskultur präglad av innovation, passion och entreprenörskap, kommer du att spela en avgörande roll i vår verksamhet och bidra till vår fortsatta tillväxt och framgång. Vi strävar efter att vara den ledande rådgivande partnern till våra kunder, skapa innovativa och effektiva lösningar som bidrar till deras framgång.
   

  

**Hur ser rollen ut?**
 Konsultchef innebär att leda vårt team av SCM experter, samtidigt som du kan vara involverad i kunduppdrag, försäljning eller andra områden som intresserar dig. Du kommer också att ha ansvar för rekrytering av nya talanger, genomföra löne- och utvecklingssamtal samt säkerställa att våra medarbetare har rätt förutsättningar för att lyckas, både genom utveckling och coaching.
   

  

**Ort:** 
 Hybrid tjänst med bas i Stockholm eller Göteborg
   

  

**Start:** 
 Omgående
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 För oss är dina personliga egenskaper viktigast. Vi tror att du är en motiverande och inspirerande ledare med affärsorienterat tänkande och som vill driva förändring. Du är van vid att arbeta med olika intressenter och har erfarenhet från konsultbranschen.
   

  

 Vidare tror vi att du tidigare har arbetat med:
   

  

* Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management
* Konsultroll inom Supply Chain, alternativt lösningsarkitekt.
* Budget- och resultatansvar samt uppföljning
* Kundmöten / Pre-Sales
* Personalansvar


 Du har god kommunikativ förmåga på svenska och engelska.
   

  

**Hur är det att arbeta på Nexer Enterprise Applications?**
 På Nexer Enterprise Applications arbetar du i en företagskultur som präglas av eget driv men samtidigt har du stöd från övriga delar av Nexer. Vi värdesätter en familjär kultur och en stark sammanhållning i teamen.
   

  

 Vi är en etablerad aktör inom Dynamics och Microsoft 365, både i Sverige och internationellt. Du får möjlighet att arbeta med både svenska och internationella kunder och bidra till deras framgång.
   

  

 Nexer Enterprise Applications består av mer än 450 experter, varav cirka 120 medarbetare i Sverige, medan resten av våra medarbetare finns i Storbritannien, Indien, Brasilien, Colombia, Portugal och USA.
   

  

 Här kan du läsa mer om oss: https://nexergroup.com/about-us/our-business-areas/ba-enterprise-applications/
   

  

**Vår kultur**
 Vår vision är "Promising future" – vi vill göra skillnad och bidra till en bättre framtid. Vi är engagerade i våra kunder och bryr oss om varandra. Vi omfamnar mångfald och tror att olika bakgrunder och erfarenheter berikar vårt arbete och företag. Vi värdesätter innovation och strävan efter att utvecklas och ta nästa steg – framåt och uppåt.
   

  

 Dessutom har vi roligt på jobbet! Vi har en entreprenöriell anda och firar våra framgångar genom regelbundna events, resor, teamaktiviteter och konferenser inom både vårt affärsområde och övriga Nexer Group.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Du är varmt välkommen att skicka in din ansökan nedan. Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via formuläret och hanterar dem löpande. Har du frågor om tjänsten eller Nexer, kontakta gärna Maja Åström på Maja.astrom@nexergroup.com. Vänta inte med att söka!

title: Engineering Manager
description:
Vi söker en empatisk och coachande Engingeering Manager med starkt teknikintresse till vår Product & Tech avdelning och området Handla
 *.* 
 I rollen som Engineering Manager blir du en viktig del i vår vision: att skapa en bättre framtid för miljoner människor. I praktiken handlar det om att vi vill fortsätta bygga grymma produkter och tjänster för att göra sparande och investeringar enklare, billigare och bättre.
 



  





 Har du passion för människor, teknik och ledarskap, gärna i kombination med ett stort personligt engagemang för aktier och fonder? Här får du möjlighet att vara kreativ och bidra på ditt sätt och samtidigt leda och motivera några av våra team inom Handla. Tillsammans med övriga ledare på Avanza arbetar du också för att skapa en tillitsfull, glädjefylld och inspirerande kultur där innovation och nytänkande står i fokus.
 



  





**Om tjänsten** 




 Handla är en av våra totalt åtta areor inom Product & Tech och innefattar vår investeringsplattform och handel av värdepapper, så som aktier och fonder, vilket inbegriper allt från exekvering till stöd och insikter. Hela Product & Tech består av 30 utvecklingsteam, som tillsammans bygger våra tjänster och erbjudanden. I rollen som Engineering Manager för Handla arbetar du nära 2 – 3 utvecklingsteam och med personalansvar för utvecklarna.
 



  





 Din främsta uppgift är att ge teamet rätt förutsättningar för att vara högpresterande och välmående. Du agerar katalysator och hjälper dem att hitta sin inre motivation och coachar dem i deras kompetensutveckling och karriär. Utöver det har du ett särskilt fokus på teamets möjlighet till effektiv mjukvaruutveckling och coachar dem i de tekniskt strategiska satsningar de står inför.
 



  





 Tillsammans med övriga chefer inom Product & Tech arbetar du både på en övergripande och strategisk nivå samt inom det specifika produktområde där Handla verkar. I detta arbete är du med och skapar vision och mål samt driver och skapar engagemang i enlighet med Avanzas strategi.
 



  





 På Avanza tror vi på agila och självstyrande team som tar fram sina egna arbetsprocesser. Varje område har mandat att själva driva sin teknik, affär och kundupplevelse. För att förverkliga våra ambitioner jobbar vi insiktsdrivet och i tvärfunktionella team. Vi tror starkt på teamarbete och värdesätter att jobba tillsammans.
 



  





**Vem vi söker** 




 I rollen som Engineering Manager behöver du kunna coacha och utveckla dina medarbetare på bästa möjliga sätt. Därför söker vi dig som har en bakgrund inom modern mjukvaruutveckling och med förståelse för de utmaningar och förutsättningar som behövs för ett lyckat agilt arbete.
 



  





 Vi tror att du har ett genuint intresse för människor och motiveras av att stötta, leda och guida andra – både individer och team. Som ledare visar du en tydlig riktning men genom ett empatiskt och coachande ledarskap som inkluderar och engagerar.
 



  





 Som Engineering Manager behövs även både mod och vilja att driva förändring, lära sig nytt, förbättra processer och produkter. Nyfikenhet och erfarenhet av förändringsledning är därför väldigt värdefullt. Då tjänsten innefattar samarbeten med många olika roller inom organisationen, är du van vid att bygga värdefulla relationer som bygger på tillit.
 



  





 Vi ser gärna att du har:
 


* Erfarenhet av personalansvar och att leda utvecklare, gärna i motsvarande roll och i ett moget techbolag.
* Erfarenhet eller stort personligt intresse kring aktier och fonder.
* Relevant högre utbildning inom teknik, IT eller motsvarande område.
* Erfarenhet av att driva och förändringsleda strategiska tekniska satsningar är meriterande.



  





 Vidare tänker vi att du har förståelse och stort intresse för teknik, du håller dig uppdaterad om vad som händer i branschen. Just nu är områden som strömmande data, personalisering, datadrivenhet, AI och cloud i fokus för oss och vi söker efter personer med erfarenhet inom dessa områden.
 



  





**Ansökan** 




 Skicka din ansökan senast den 11 augusti 2024 genom att klicka på knappen ”Ansök” nedan. Vi tar inte emot ansökningar via mejl p.g.a. GDPR.
 



  





 Under semestertider kan återkoppling på din ansökan dröja lite längre än vanligt, vi hoppas på ditt överseende med detta. Har du frågor om tjänsten är du varmt välkommen att höra av dig till Thomas Bauer eller Linn Keife på thomas.bauer@avanza.se eller linn.keife@avanza.se alternativt rekrytering@avanza.se, så återkommer vi till dig så snart som möjligt.
 



  





 Varmt välkommen men din ansökan och glad sommar!
 



  





  





*Erbjudanden från rekryteringsföretag/annonssäljare undanbedes.*

title: Instructor, Trilogy (Remote) - $100,000/year USD
description:
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Have you got what it takes?
   

  

 Is translating educational theories into actionable assessments your superpower? Do you thrive in environments where excellence is the norm, dissecting and designing with a level of precision that only the keenest eye can achieve?
   

  

 We're scouting for an expert in psychometrics with a flair for distilling complex educational measurements into clear, effective tests to sculpt revolutionary educational experiences. Think you have checked all the right boxes so far? Then this is your opportunity to shine.
   

  

 At Trilogy, we're not just tinkering with the idea of AI in education; we're orchestrating a full-blown transformation. Scrap the old playbook of manual test creation. Textbooks? Obsolete. In this role, you will wield the power of generative AI to design prompts that delve deep into the subject matter, commanding it to produce test content that's personalized, engaging, and rigorous.
   

  

 Your experience in quantitative measurement and educational content creation will help you synthesize complex frameworks into AI prompts, yielding razor-sharp test questions that align tightly with educational standards. You will then quality control your outputs by crafting AI-first rubrics, ensuring each question and answer hits the mark and stimulates curiosity, enriching the learning journey. It's all about a relentless pursuit of excellence, a continuous cycle of refinement, and a dedication to content that not only meets but exceeds the bar.
   

  

 If you're seeking a role where you can blend creativity with technology and where your contributions have a lasting impact, Trilogy is where you belong. Take the leap and apply now!
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Creating and refining test content to meet rigorous educational standards, using a blend of psychometrics and generative AI tools
* Developing assessment rubrics with the help of AI that evaluate the depth, alignment, and educational impact of the test content
* Enhancing the quality of test content through a streamlined, iterative process for consistently superior and challenging assessments


**What You Won’t Be Doing**
* Creating test content manually – you will be using generative AI tools (such as ChatGPT, Gemini, Claude etc.) for every task
* Developing code to automate systems - you will focus on test design using AI, while our engineers handle the tech specifics


**Instructor Key Responsibilities**
 Applying your psychometric expertise to develop and refine test content with the help of AI, ensuring the assessments are personalized, rigorous, and aligned with educational standards
   

  

**Basic Requirements**
* Bachelor's degree or higher with a focus on psychometrics, educational measurement and statistics, OR at least 3 years of experience creating content for standardized tests (SAT, ACT, etc.) within an edtech environment
* Basic familiarity with and an eagerness to rapidly master AI tools and their application in test content development
* A user-centric approach and the ability to critically evaluate content in terms of appropriateness, accuracy, and relevance


**About Trilogy**
 Hundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.
   

  

 There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!
   

  

**Working with Crossover**
 This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $50 USD/hour, which equates to $100,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.
   

  

**What to expect next:**
* You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.
* Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.


**Important!** 
 If you do not receive an email from us:
   

  

* First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.
* Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.
* Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.
* If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.

title: Senior Product Manager, Trilogy (Remote) - $200,000/year USD

 There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!

 This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $100 USD/hour, which equates to $200,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly.  If you do not receive an email from us:

title: System Center Automation Specialist
description:
**Har du erfarenhet av att arbeta med PowerShell, Microsoft Windows Servers, Microsoft SQL Servers och System Center Service Manager och Orchestrator? I så fall tror vi att du skulle passa väl in hos oss på Innofactor som System Center Automation Specialist.**
**Om Rollen**
 I rollen som teknisk specialist och rådgivare hos oss kommer du att få erfarenhet av att arbeta med kunder inom olika branscher och storlekar, med lösningar anpassade efter deras behov och önskemål. Det innebär att du kommer att hantera supportärenden och förändringsarbete inom dessa teknologier, samtidigt som du utvecklar och förbättrar våra processer och rutiner. Du kommer att ha nära samarbete med både interna och externa parter och vara en viktig del av vårt leveransteam.
   

  

**Stämmer detta in på dig?**
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av att arbeta med System Center Service Manager och Orchestrator.
* God kunskap och erfarenhet av PowerShell.
* Tidigare och nuvarande erfarenhet av Microsoft Windows Servers och Microsoft SQL Servers.
* Förmåga att arbeta både självständigt och i team.
* God kommunikations- och samarbetsförmåga.
* Serviceinriktad och lösningsorienterad inställning.
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.


**Det Är Meriterande Om Du Har Erfarenhet Av**
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med andra CRM- och ärendehanteringssystem, såsom Dynamics 365 och ServiceNow.
* Certifieringar inom relevanta områden, som Microsoft Certified: Azure Administrator Associate eller Microsoft 365 Certified: Fundamentals
* Intresse för att lära dig nya teknologier och utveckla dina kunskaper.


**Be The Real You**
 Hos oss kan du vara dig själv! Här är ingen stöpt i samma form. Vi värdesätter våra medarbetares olikheter och tror att utmanande uppgifter kräver nya och olika perspektiv. Alla har olika kvaliteter, och därför tror vi inte på att skriva ner en lista på egenskaper som vi söker. Det som däremot är viktigt är att du gillar att lösa komplexa problem och sprida kunskap. För att trivas i rollen bör du ha god kommunikations- och samarbetsförmåga, både på svenska och engelska. För att briljera i rollen gillar du att vara konsultmässig vilket för oss innebär att du hjälper våra kunder och är ett steg före, vilket gör att du kan föreslå nya lösningar eller utmaningar som du identifierar. Vi ser fram emot att höra ifrån dig

title: IT Application Specialist till Linde Gas
description:
Linde Gas söker en stark problemlösare med passion för teknik som vill fortsätta utvecklas i rollen som Applikationsspecialist. Här en del av ett starkt team med hög kompetens och engagemang. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
 



  

**Företag :**
 Linde Gas
 



  

**Plats :**
 Solna, Stockholm
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 IT
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Enligt överenskommelse
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Rekrytering
 



  

**Övrigt :**
 Möjlighet till distansarbete
   




**Om tjänsten**

 Som Applikationsspecialist på Linde Gas kommer du att ansvara för två plattformar, Accura och Linx. Accura är en egenutvecklad applikation som används av Lindes kunder, såsom sjukhus, för att hantera lager och beställningar. Linx är en handdatorapplikation för Lindes återförsäljare i syfte att hålla koll på lagerhållning. Du kommer att arbeta nära applikationsägare och externa partners för att underhålla och förbättra dessa system, samt säkerställa att de fungerar optimalt.
 


  


  

**Du erbjuds**



  

  
* Möjligheten att arbeta på ett globalt företag med stora utvecklingsmöjligheter
  
* Stöd och utbildning för att utveckla din tekniska kompetens
  
* En dynamisk arbetsmiljö med engagerade och kunniga kollegor
  

  


**Arbetsuppgifter**
  
* Utföra underhåll, uppdatering och utveckling på plattformarna
  
* Ge kvalificerad systemteknisk support i samarbete med applikationsögare
  
* Arbeta direkt med applikationsägare för att förstå och hjälpa till att definiera nya applikationskrav
  
* Säkerställa lämplig kunskapsöverföring för applikationer som utvecklats med externa partners för att möjliggöra internt stöd
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**
  
* Har en relevant utbildningsbakgrund, troligtvis inom IT
  
* Har erfarenhet av applikationsutveckling, och gärna SAP-relaterad
  
* Grundläggande kunskaper i Java och Azure
  
* Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift
  
* Har en bred teknisk bakgrund
  
* Har erfarenhet av att hantera leverantörer
  


  


  

**För att lyckas i rollen har du följande personliga egenskaper:**



  

  
* Målmedveten
  
* Ordningsam
  
* Stabil
  
* Ansvarstagande
  


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
   




**Linde Gas**

 Linde är ett ledande globalt företag inom industrigaser och teknik. Linde lever efter sin mission att göra vår värld mer produktiv varje dag genom att tillhandahålla högkvalitativa lösningar, teknologier och tjänster som gör deras kunder mer framgångsrika och hjälper till att upprätthålla, avkarbonisera och skydda vår planet.
 


  


 Lindes industrigaser och teknologier används i otaliga applikationer, inklusive produktion av ren väte som är kritisk för energiomställningen, livräddande medicinsk syrgas och högrenade specialgaser för elektronik, bland annat. I över 50 år har Linde varit en global ledare inom väte och utnyttjar sin ingenjörskompetens, tillsammans med en betydande tillgångsbas och expertis, för att göra renare energi till verklighet världen över.
   




**Bli direktrekryterad till Linde Gas**

 Detta är en direktrekrytering, vilket betyder att den kandidat som får tjänsten blir direktanställd av kundföretaget. Rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av Academic Work.
   




**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Mikaela Hofstedt eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på stv3@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15105985

title: Sales Executive Digital Workplace Solutions
description:
We are Lenovo. We do what we say. We own what we do. We WOW our customers.
   

  

 Lenovo is a US$62 billion revenue global technology powerhouse, ranked #217 in the Fortune Global 500, employing 77,000 people around the world, and serving millions of customers every day in 180 markets. Focused on a bold vision to deliver smarter technology for all, Lenovo has built on its success as the world’s largest PC company by further expanding into growth areas that fuel the advancement of ‘New IT’ technologies (client, edge, cloud, network, and intelligence) including server, storage, mobile, software, solutions, and services.
   

  

 This transformation together with Lenovo’s world-changing innovation is building a more inclusive, trustworthy, and smarter future for everyone, everywhere. To find out more visit www.lenovo.com, and read about the latest news via our StoryHub.
   

  

 We are seeking a proactive and growth-focused Senior Sales Executive to drive Lenovo's ambitious growth and recognition in Digital Workplace Solutions (DWS). We are on the lookout for dynamic individuals who thrive on challenges in pursuing new business opportunities and have a proven history of securing high-impact, strategic deals.
   

  

 This role is at the forefront of our strategy to drive value for us customers through services and solutions. Successful candidates will get an opportunity make a substantial impact in advancing this strategy and also accelerate personal growth.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
 Strategic Opportunity Pursuits:
   

  

* Proactively pursue new business opportunities, prioritizing TCV-driven sales and structuring contracts that align with long-term objectives for both clients and Lenovo.
* Targeted-oriented conversion of high-value strategic deals with total contract value (TCV) focus of $20 Mn and above, with compelling proposals and high-impact negotiations.


**Swift Deal Execution**
* Streamline the sales process from the client perspective to close deals quickly while maintaining service quality and client satisfaction.
* Transition seamlessly to the next strategic opportunity after deal closure.


**New Business Acquisition**
* Develop and execute a strategic approach for lead generation and prospect engagement within target customer organizations, while also strategically upselling and cross-selling additional solutions to existing clients.
* Leverage strong prospecting skills to Identify and initiate contact with potential clients with a persuasive approach to close deals effectively.


**Relationship Building And Collaboration**
* Cultivate and maintain strong customer relationships, driving unwavering client loyalty and retention.
* Collaborate with other in-territory counterparts and matrix teams to achieve the shared goal of growth.


**Qualifications**
* The ideal candidate must have 5-6 years of direct selling experience for a range of Digital Workplace Solutions with evidence of closing deals greater than $20 Mn+ TCV.
* Large and complex deal exposure to Managed Services experienced with selling DWS solutions to large enterprise customers ($billion+ revenues).
* Proven track record in B2B sales with a focus on strategic deals, and a TCV targeted approach for consistently exceeding sales targets.
* Strong understanding of Digital Workplace solutions, IT services, and technology trends.
* Entrepreneurial mindset with the ability to navigate ambiguity and thrive in challenging situations.
* Experience driving deals with hardware and software components is a plus


**What Lenovo Can Offer You**
* Opportunities for career development growth
* Access to various training
* Performance-based rewards
* Flexible working environment (combination of working from home/office)


*We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any federal, state, or local protected class.*

title: Head Of Marketing, Trilogy (Remote) - $400,000/year USD
description:
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Have you got what it takes?
   

  

 If you think most CEOs are full of themselves (and full of other stuff)... keep reading.
   

  

 Here’s a CEO track that requires — and actually rewards — zero experience being a CEO. In this role, you’ll become an incredibly effective, customer-facing CEO in an environment with more than 100 software products.
   

  

 Who You Are
   

  

 You’ve never been a CEO before. Probably because most of the time, “CEO” is just a 3-letter code for “an exhausting hamster wheel of team building and internal operations logistics.” And hopping on that hamster wheel would be a huge waste of your talent and potential.
   

  

 You’re smart. You keep things clear and direct. And while you’ve worked in SaaS for many years, you don’t have a decade of outdated “leadership” learnings to unlearn. You’re ready to be the leader that smart employees like you have been waiting for. This job right here is your launchpad.
   

  

 You're a generative AI power user. You've used ChatGPT, Claude, Bard, or a similar tool to automate previously manual workflows (note: this role does not require a software development background).
   

  

 You should already be well on your way to building a strong personal brand. We believe in the importance of a personal brand, and we’ll help you develop yours. You should understand the benefits and impact of a personal brand, the long-tail nature of content, and the effort it takes.
   

  

 You have experience with quickly moving products, particularly in leadership roles during the launch of epic new features. If you’ve been part of teams going from Seed through Series A/B rounds, that’s a huge plus. You’ve got proven ability to get customers excited about new product features and have used metrics like net dollar retention and win-back rates (and others) to measure the impact of new product features.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Implementing AI-driven Productivity Improvements: Utilizing generative AI tools to streamline and automate various workflows across the company.
* Customer Engagement and Feedback: Interacting with customers to gather insights and feedback, and using this information to enhance product offerings.
* Develop a Personal Monopoly: Publishing podcast episodes and blog posts and building a social media following to evangelize your portfolio's AI-driven products.


**What You Won’t Be Doing**
* Busywork that drains your creativity.
* Day-in, day-out team management or internal operations that distract from your vision.
* Tinker with the business model to figure out what works. (Remember, we’re giving you the playbook.)


**Basic Requirements**
**Head Of Marketing key responsibilities**
* At least 8 years of work experience in the enterprise software industry
* Leadership experience in marketing, sales, business development, partnerships, professional services, or another hands-on customer-facing domain
* Experience using generative AI tools to achieve quantifiable productivity improvements
* Currently based in North America, South America, or Europe


**About Trilogy**
 Hundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.
   

  

 There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!
   

  

**Working with Crossover**
 This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $200 USD/hour, which equates to $400,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.
   

  

**What to expect next:**
* You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.
* Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.


**Important!** 
 If you do not receive an email from us:
   

  

* First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.
* Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.
* Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.
* If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.


 Crossover Job Code: LJ-4649-SE-Stockhol-HeadOfMarketin.006
